issueDTO.title: Implement the Puzzle Dependency Module
issueDTO.description:
This PuzzleDependency module handles logic to determine whether a user can access a particular puzzle based on the completion status of other puzzles. It enables puzzle chaining and progression design in the scavenger hunt game.

**Tasks:**

* Create the `PuzzleDependency` entity to represent relationships between puzzles.
* Implement logic to check if a user is eligible to unlock a puzzle based on its dependencies.
* Build admin-facing CRUD endpoints to manage puzzle dependencies (e.g. set which puzzles unlock others).

**Note:**
This module must be completely standalone. It should not rely on any other module and must encapsulate all logic related to dependency checking and puzzle unlock flow.

issueDTO.title: Standalone User Ranking System
issueDTO.description:
This UserRankingModule tracks and manages user ranks based on multiple criteria such as scores, achievements, or activity metrics. It calculates user ranks independently and provides an endpoint to retrieve the current rank for any user. The module should be fully standalone without relying on other modules.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Define `UserRank` entity to store user rank data and relevant metrics
* [ ] Implement score calculation logic combining multiple ranking criteria
* [ ] Create API endpoint: `GET /users/:id/rank` to fetch the rank of a specific user

issueDTO.title: Implement a User Report Card Functionality
issueDTO.description:
Implement a standalone UserReportCard module that generates a report card for each user, summarizing their participation in the NFT scavenger hunt. This report includes completed puzzles, earned rewards, and overall progress. It provides a clear, concise snapshot of a user’s game activity.

This module will **not** depend on any other module. Any required data should be mocked or injected independently for now.

---

### ✅ Tasks

* Create the `ReportCard` entity with fields such as `userId`, `completedPuzzles`, `rewardsEarned`, and `progressPercentage`.
* Build logic to calculate summary stats for each user based on mock data or injected services.
* Implement a `GET /users/:id/report-card` endpoint to fetch a user’s report card.
* Ensure all files are encapsulated within a `user-report-card` directory/module.

---

### 📁 Expected Structure

```
src/
  user-report-card/
    ├── user-report-card.module.ts
    ├── user-report-card.controller.ts
    ├── user-report-card.service.ts
    ├── entities/
    │   └── report-card.entity.ts
    └── dto/
        └── report-card.dto.ts
```

issueDTO.title: Query on Inconsistent Session Time Display
issueDTO.description: 原因も再現性も仕様なのかもよく分からないのですがとりあえず報告させていただきます。 #### **Description** Hello, I've observed an inconsistency between the session time displayed in the Claude Code extension UI and the time shown by the `ccusage` command-line tool, and I would like to ask if this is the intended behavior. Currently, the extension UI indicates the session resets at 6 PM, which is the actual time the session ends. However, the `ccusage blocks --live` monitor in the terminal shows the session ending at a different time (8 PM in the attached screenshot). This difference can be a bit confusing as it's not clear which timer to follow. Could you please clarify if this is the expected behavior? #### **Steps to Observe the Behavior** 1. On macOS with the latest version of VS Code. 2. Have the Claude Code extension installed. 3. In the VS Code integrated terminal, run the command `ccusage@latest blocks --live`. 4. The time displayed by the extension in the editor's top bar ("resets at 6pm") differs from the "Remaining" time in the `ccusage` monitor (e.g., shows end time of 8:00:00 PM). #### **My Expectation** For clarity, I would expect both timers to be synchronized and reflect the actual session end time. #### **Screenshots** As shown in the screenshot, the top right of the IDE indicates a reset time of 6 PM, while the `ccusage` session monitor in the terminal shows a session end time of 8 PM. #### **Environment** * **OS:** macOS * **IDE:** Visual Studio Code (Latest Version) * **Tool:** `ccusage@latest` * **Extension Name & Version:** Claude Code `[Please add extension version if known]` Thank you for looking into this.

issueDTO.title: storage_service/get_natural_endpoints has no way to pass a key containing a colon character
issueDTO.description:
As noted by @KrzaQ:
> How do I use nodetool getendpoints with compound keys? The internet advice seems to be pass the key separated by colon (e.g. nodetool getendpoints mykeyspace superheroes "peter:parker" ), but what do I do if the key itself contains colons?
In my case - audit.audit_log, one of the columns is of type timestamp, so a value could be 2023-12-31 00:00:00.000000+0000 .
I tried following the java code for the tool, but no luck yet.

To enable support at the jmx/nodetool level (or scylla-nodetool), the scylla api needs to support a way to pass key values containing `:`, otherwise they are recognized as composite keys, with the column as key delimiter.

Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).
comments: Although it isn't specified in the RFC (https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986#section-3.4) many libraries allow passing the same query parameter multiple times, e.g. `somequery?key=3&key=4`. If Seastar doesn't mess this up (e.g., by using a map instead of a list), this can be a way to specify two key components without needing to invent yet another serialization format.

According to https://support.datastax.com/s/article/HOW-TO-Specify-composite-partition-keys-for-SSTable-utilities, the colon is expected to work - although this isn't officially specified in the nodetool getendpoints documentation so I'm note sure we should follow this bad advice:

The reason why this is a bad syntax is that it makes keys like "a:b" ambiguous - is it one component with the ":" character, or two components? It's not an issue of implementation, it's a bug in nodetool syntax that makes this case ambiguous and nodetool has no idea what the user intended.

> Since the key is passed over an http-based interface I suggest to allow encoding `:` characters using the standard http encoding as `%3A` substrings (`seastar::http::internal::url_decode` can be used to decode such strings).

I'm not sure if that was your intention, but such encoding (which obviously has to happen when building the REST API URL), will not help to differentiate whether "a:b" is two components or one with a colon. Also, if the nodetool API is already ambgious (what does the "a:b" the user passed mean?) there is no way that additional encoding can fix it.

If you change anything in this area, please don't forget to add tests.

From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`.
The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

That said, allowing passing multiple components as request parameters is possible too, though with the current interface it is not intuitive to assume that the multiple key parameters indicate multiple components of a composite key rather than multiple keys, if the API supported returning the natural endpoints for multiple keys.

Note that `%3A` is supported for `keyspace:table` "tuples" when passed as a single parameter or as a comma-separated list of `keyspace:table`, to support keyspace or table names containing `:`.

> From the api standpoint what I had in mind is to pass `key=a%3Ab` if the non-composite key (or one of its components) contains `:`. The user can pass that to nodetool as well.

`key=a%3Ab` is the url-encoded form of setting key to `a:b`. But now that Scylla receives it, how does it know if this was intended to be a string key `a:b` or two components?

Maybe you were thinking of encoding **twice**? If that's the case, the first layer of encoding doesn't need to be URL encoding. Just the outer layer of encoding must be.

Are you sure about what you said about `keyspace:table` allowing real ":"? Last time I checked, I found that at least in one context, you are only allowed to have colons in the table name, not keyspace name (e.g., in Alternator GSI), and what happens is simply that Scylla splits only on the first colon, so `xyz:abc:qwe` means that `xyz` is the keyspace, `abc:qwe` is the table. That's a different thing that what you are hoping to do here.
Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

> Can't we use key:"value:has:colons"?

Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed).
But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Like @nyh said, we still need to fix the nodetool layer to support composite keys containing `:`.
There, one could use string quoting or even hex encoding to represent binary key values.

> Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.

But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
 
> Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.

Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

> > Of course, that's one way to represent it (with taking care of escaping `"` characters within the string if needed). But we need to be consistent, and the proposal to use %3A to encode column characters is consistent with an http-based REST API.
> 
> But it won't be "consistent" - you'll need to run the URL encoding **twice**, which is possible, but not something traditionally done in HTTP. So we gain nothing by making the "inner" encoding also another invocation of the URL encoding, it can be something else like quotes or backslashing colons or something. Whatever this inner encoding is, it will need to be documented.
> 
> > Introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. `ckey`, that can be given multiple times to build the key is also an elegant option that is consistent with REST API.
> 
> Yes, this is similar to what I suggested above, although theoretically you don't even need to change the existing option "key" if you just allow it to be given multiple times - unless giving a key multiple times has another meaning in the API (maybe an OR of several different keys)? @amnonh would know.

Currently, it's a singleton, see:
https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/blob/f4bd86384b6ffbcab9af876f83b288bf3e83eab3/api/api-doc/storage_service.json#L565-L568
And we also have this limitation: https://github.com/scylladb/seastar/issues/693

> And we also have this limitation:#693

Wrong link?
Sorry, it's a seastar issue, updated the commnet

Another user just encountered this bug, being unable to use "nodetool getendpoints" with a partition key value that contained the ":"  character. That user, like probably a majority of users, had a single-column (non-compound) partition key. 

We can easily create a fix  for such users: partition_key::from_nodetool_style_string() could check if the schema has a single partition-key component, and if so, avoid the "split on :" logic entirely.

This fix will **not** help in the more general case of compound partition keys (for which an API change is required, as described above), but it would have helped this user, and all other users who have non-compound partition keys.

@amnonh suggested an API improvement for the general case (of compound partition keys, that do need a separator character): 
```
It's also possible to allow the user to override the delimiter (like we do in sed) for this cases
```
Adding this feature to the REST API will be easy, but adding it to nodetool will require a new option.
If my idea above for single-component partition key not splitting at all is _also_ implemented, many users including the ones that noticed this problem will not actually need to use this option.

@bhalevy I've created https://github.com/scylladb/scylladb/pull/24720 based on @nyh idea.
I'm not sure it's the right approach, but you can take it from here

summary.main: The storage service's get_natural_endpoints API has no way to pass a key containing a colon character, which is a significant issue that affects the usability of the API. The expected behavior is for the API to support passing keys with colon characters.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the API to support passing keys with colon characters. This is a significant issue that affects the usability of the storage service's get_natural_endpoints API.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by allowing encoding of colon characters using standard HTTP encoding as %3A substrings. This can be done by introducing a new option for composite keys, e.g. ckey, that can be given multiple times to build the key. Another suggestion is to use string quoting or even hex encoding to represent binary key values.

issueDTO.title: Implement locale code re-mapping
comments:
Great idea @seppviljar mind sharing more details why would you like to re-map the locale codes?

I'd like to understand the idea behind the idea, to make sure it will make sense for the rest of the users too, when we add this.

What's the use case?

Thanks @maxprilutskiy 

It’s more about mapping Lingo.dev’s locale codes to our (custom) file names — so I can use my current files without having to rename them first to Lingo.dev’s expected locale format and then back again. 
Mapping support in Lingo.dev would let me avoid those two extra, inconvenient steps.

It also makes it a bit more predictable. For example, mapping "pt-BR": "pt" ensures that my existing file is both directly modifiable and also clearly tied to the Brazilian version — not Portuguese (Portugal), which _might_ be the default for a two-letter locale code.

1. I copy an entry of `personal.bib`. That entry has attached a PDF `A.pdf`.
2. I paste that entry to `paper.bib`.
3. `A.pdf` should be copied to the file directory of library `paper.bib`

In summary: All attached files should be copied if original files are not reachable from new library. One needs to keep the relative path structure while copying (to keep the files field unmodified)

issueDTO.title: Add `approximation_degree` argument to `CommutativeCancellation`  pass and set it in the preset
issueDTO.description:
Oh we didn't add the argument to `CommutativeCancellation` that seems like an oversight since we don't actually run `CommutationAnalysis` manually. We should fix this in 2.1 so there is an `approximation_degree` on the cancellation pass that internally passes it to the analysis and we use that in the preset pass managers, I'll convert this comment into an issue.

_Originally posted by @mtreinish in https://github.com/Qiskit/qiskit/pull/14021#discussion_r2017641853_

The `CommutativeCancellation` pass internally calls `CommutationAnalysis` which takes an approximation degree parameter. But we don't expose this argument via commutative cancellation. We should fix this oversight and add the argument to commutative cancellation and then wire it up so setting `approximation_degree` in a preset pass manager passes it through to commutation analysis.

issueDTO.title: Create `fedify webfinger` command for isolated WebFinger lookups
issueDTO.description:
## Description

Create a new `fedify webfinger <handle>` command that performs isolated WebFinger lookups. While the existing `lookup` command performs comprehensive object retrieval including WebFinger, there are many cases where users only want to test WebFinger configuration. This command takes a `@user@domain` handle as an argument and outputs only the WebFinger result (JRD) in JSON format.

## Implementation Details

- Create a new `webfinger.ts` file in the CLI directory, using `lookup.ts` as a reference
- Utilize the existing `lookupWebFinger()` function from the Fedify library
- Add the new command to `mod.ts` to register it with the CLI
- Output results in clean JSON format for easy parsing
- Handle WebFinger-specific errors appropriately

## Why This Is a Good First Issue

- **Independent feature**: Add new functionality without modifying existing code
- **Learn structure**: Experience the complete process of adding a new CLI command
- **Code reuse**: Great example of leveraging existing Fedify library functions
- **Focused scope**: Single-purpose command with clear input/output expectations

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Create `fedify webfinger <handle>` command
- [ ] Accept `@user@domain` format handles as input
- [ ] Output WebFinger JRD results in JSON format
- [ ] Handle invalid handles and WebFinger lookup failures gracefully
- [ ] Register the command in the CLI module system
- [ ] Add appropriate help text and usage examples

## Files to Create/Modify

- `cli/webfinger.ts` - New command implementation
- `cli/mod.ts` - Register the new command

## Example Usage

```bash
fedify webfinger @user@example.com
fedify webfinger @mastodon@mastodon.social
```

repository.name: fedify

summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by creating a new `webfinger.ts` file in the CLI directory, utilizing the existing `lookupWebFinger()` function from the Fedify library, adding the new command to `mod.ts`, and outputting results in clean JSON format.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with the new command implementation, registration, and example usage.

issueDTO.title: Extra parameters in MSSQL Hook breaks sqlalchemy connections
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow Provider(s)

microsoft-mssql

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

apache-airflow-providers-microsoft-mssql==4.4.2

### Apache Airflow version

2.10.5

### Operating System

RHEL 8.10

### Deployment

Virtualenv installation

### Deployment details

_No response_

### What happened

Hi. the newly added feature in [#44310](https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/44310) breaks existing connections if `driver` or `encrypt` parameters are used in the extras:

Probably more parameters may exhibit similar errors. These extras are needed by the MSSQL hook, but we cannot blindly accept these will work in pymssql connections.

Example connection:
```json
{
  "conn_type": "mssql",
  "extra": {
    "driver": "ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server",
    "encrypt": "yes",
    "sqlalchemy_scheme": "mssql+pyodbc"
  },
    "host": "xxx",
    "login": "xxx",
    "password": "xxx",
    "port": 1433,
    "schema": "master"
}
```

Errors when using an SQLQueryExecutor using the above connection:

```python
File "src/pymssql/_pymssql.pyx", line 586, in pymssql._pymssql.connect
TypeError: connect() got an unexpected keyword argument 'driver'

File "src/pymssql/_pymssql.pyx", line 586, in pymssql._pymssql.connect
TypeError: connect() got an unexpected keyword argument 'encrypt'
```

### What you think should happen instead

These conenctions should continue working as they did in `apache-airflow-providers-microsoft-mssql==3.9.2`

### How to reproduce

Have MSSQL connections defined with `extra` parameters
Install `apache-airflow-providers-microsoft-mssql` >= 4.0.0
Try an mssql hook using sqlalchemy

### Anything else

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments: cc @jx2lee

@eladkal I’ll take a look at it tomorrow!

@emredjan Thanks for the report! Planning to fix it soon — but happy to do Pull request yourself if it’s time-sensitive! I can assist

Thanks @jx2lee , it's not that urgent as we can use 3.9.2 without issues. I may have a look at fixing it, but not really sure what's the best way. Reverting the change, or adding an error checking for extras that are not supported in pymssql, or some other option..

@emredjan 
Instead of expanding `MsSqlHook` to accept ODBC-specific options, why not lean on the hooks that already match each driver?

- **pymssql → `MsSqlHook`**  
  The hook defaults to the `mssql+pymssql` dialect and is tuned for that stack.
- **pyodbc → `OdbcHook`**  
  `OdbcHook` uses `pyodbc` under the hood and already exposes a `driver` parameter via connection extras/hook params, so no extra work is needed.

Keeping the hooks focused means:
1. We avoid adding more branching logic to `MsSqlHook`.
2. Users choose the hook that matches their driver, which is consistent with how other database providers work.

What’s your take? Assuming that's reasonable, would you be open to switching to [`OdbcHook`](https://airflow.apache.org/docs/apache-airflow-providers-odbc/stable/_api/airflow/providers/odbc/hooks/odbc/index.html) and resolving this issue?

issueDTO.title: Convert `Option<Vec<sort expression>>` to `Vec<sort expression>`
issueDTO.description:
Consider `AggregateFunction.order_by` field -- it is `Option<Vec< /*sort expr*/ >>`
`None` means "no sorting" but this can be modeled as `Some( vec![] )`.
Empty collection perfectly describes lack of sorting, so no need to wrap if with optional value.

Remove `Option` and keep just `Vec`.

This can be applied to 

- `AggregateFunction.order_by`
- `ExprFuncBuilder.order_by`
- ...

based on https://github.com/apache/datafusion/pull/12178#discussion_r1732636238 cc @crepererum
comments: take
plan to work on this after https://github.com/apache/datafusion/issues/12193, as the two will conflict.
Hi @findepi, can I take it if you do not work on it anymore?
sure, go for it!

This issue needs is to in scripts/example.groovy script file automatically detect the conf/graphs/hugegraph.properties file in the backend is rocksdb, if so change it to memory, But at the same time do not override the original conf/graphs/hugegraph.properties file?

> Hello! I saw these three pr [#2518](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph/pull/2518) [#2519](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph/pull/2519) and [apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc#354](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hugegraph-doc/pull/354). This issue needs is to in scripts/example.groovy script file automatically detect the conf/graphs/hugegraph.properties file in the backend is rocksdb, if so change it to memory, But at the same time do not override the original conf/graphs/hugegraph.properties file?

The essence of this issue is that when using Gremlin-Console Stand-alone in offline mode, some unexpected problems occur when using the RocksDB backend (the cause of which has not yet been identified). Therefore, a **temporary** switch to using the memory backend is suggested to circumvent it.

To completely resolve this issue, it is necessary to identify and address the errors related to using the RocksDB backend.

issueDTO.title: Change default `kubelet-preferred-address-types` to prioritize InternalIP for more reliable node connectivity
issueDTO.description:
In Kamaji, the default preferred `NodeAddressTypes` for the API server to connect to Kubelets is currently configured as: ``` --kubelet-preferred-address-types=Hostname,InternalIP,ExternalIP ``` See: [github.com/clastix/kamaji/api/v1alpha1/tenantcontrolplane_types.go#L71](https://github.com/clastix/kamaji/blob/3fd1882e435a087a1234e3b0f011bebde265aea9/api/v1alpha1/tenantcontrolplane_types.go#L71)
This makes `Hostname` the first preference for the API server when connecting to nodes for Kubelet(`Hostname:KubeletPort`) for operations like `kubectl logs`, `exec`, `port-forward`, and more.
### Why this causes issues If the node hostname is not resolvable with the DNS server, the operations fail with errors like: ``` dial tcp: lookup node1 on 10.96.0.10:53: no such host ``` This happens because: * The API server tries to resolve the node’s hostname via CoreDNS (typically `10.96.0.10:53`). * CoreDNS forwards the query to the external DNS configured in `/etc/resolv.conf` (since CoreDNS itself does not have entries for node names by default). * If the external DNS does not have records for these node hostnames, the lookup fails and API server → kubelet connection is broken. In some environments, such as certain cloud providers or corporate networks where hostnames are registered in external DNS, this may work. However, relying on external DNS having entries for your nodes introduces fragility and environment-specific dependency.
### Proposal **Kubeadm defaults to**: ``` --kubelet-preferred-address-types=InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname ``` This prioritizes `InternalIP`, which is routable inside the cluster or VPC, avoiding DNS resolution issues for node hostnames. Therefore update Kamaji’s default `preferredAddressTypes` to: ``` --kubelet-preferred-address-types=InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname ``` This change reduces dependency on external DNS or custom CoreDNS configuration and provides better out-of-the-box reliability for most environments, especially on-prem or private clouds where nodes have valid InternalIPs but hostnames may not be resolvable via CoreDNS or external DNS. Furthermore, if nodes are in separate private networks and the API server cannot directly reach their `InternalIP`, Konnectivity can be deployed to establish reliable connectivity (Konnectivity is enabled by default in Kamaji TCP pods). ### Changes - Update the default value of `TenantControlPlane.Spec.Kubernetes.Kubelet.PreferredAddressTypes` to: `"InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname"`. - Update the default value of `KamajiControlPlane.Spec.Kubelet.PreferredAddressTypes` to: `"InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname"`.
comments: LGTM, are you up to get this issue sorted out by contributing to Kamaji?
Yes. Please assign this to me.
Done @parthyadav3105, thanks.

repository.description: Kamaji is the Hosted Control Plane Manager for Kubernetes.
repository.name: kamaji

summary.main: The default `kubelet-preferred-address-types` in Kamaji is currently configured as `--kubelet-preferred-address-types=Hostname,InternalIP,ExternalIP`, which prioritizes `Hostname` for node connectivity, causing issues if the node hostname is not resolvable with the DNS server. The proposal is to update the default to `--kubelet-preferred-address-types=InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname` to prioritize `InternalIP` for more reliable node connectivity.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the default preferred `NodeAddressTypes` for the API server to connect to Kubelets to prioritize `InternalIP` for more reliable node connectivity across all environments, especially on-prem or private clouds where nodes have valid InternalIPs but hostnames may not be resolvable via CoreDNS or external DNS.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by updating the default value of `TenantControlPlane.Spec.Kubernetes.Kubelet.PreferredAddressTypes` and `KamajiControlPlane.Spec.Kubelet.PreferredAddressTypes` to `"InternalIP,ExternalIP,Hostname"`.

    suspicious/useGuardForIn
    suspicious/useIsArray
    suspicious/useNamespaceKeyword
    suspicious/useNumberToFixedDigitsArgument
    suspicious/useStrictMode
```

### Rule name

lint/nursery/noUselessUndefined

### Playground link

https://biomejs.dev/playground/?lintRules=all&code=KAApACAAPQA%2BACAAdQBuAGQAZQBmAGkAbgBlAGQA&language=ts

### Expected result

unicorn/no-useless-undefined does not flag this when the option "checkArrowFunctionBody" is set to false.

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow Biome's Code of Conduct
comments: I do not see checkArrowFunctionBody option in no_useless_undefined? no options on that rule as yet :-(. However there is an interesting conflict of rules:
We don't have one yet, but I think we can ignore undefined in an arrow function body by default? May need some discussion

First, thank you for your efforts.

You could have something like this:

```ts
(): string | undefined => undefined
```

In this case only the noUselessUndefined rule would kick in.

To fix this one could write:

```ts
(): string | undefined => {}
```

But then the noEmptyBlockStatements rule would flag this.

In my opinion ignoring `undefined` in arrow functions would be the best option, because in a "normal" function the rule flags if you write `return undefined`. This can be fixed by just writing `return`. In an arrow function you cannot do this. I guess that is why the unicorn eslint plugin introduced that option I meantioned.
so your suggestion @atheck is to add `checkArrowFunctionBody` option thanks

I don't feel like we've clearly established the use case that requires adding this option. Is it just so we can let users write empty functions and not conflict with `noEmptyBlockStatements`?

Also regarding return in an arrow function, you should be able to do this:
```
() => { return; }
```

I think we could make an exception for `() => undefined`. In other cases of the rules the action can simply remove `undefined`, while here it is not the case, we have to turn it into `{}`. And to avoid triggering `noEmptyBlock` this should even be `{ return; }`, `{ ; }`, or `{ /* undefined value */ }` that look hacky.
@Conaclos I agree.

Actually I even wonder if we should not always allow `return undefined`. This is a bit a stretch, however I find that `retrun;` and `return undefined;` convey different meaning: the first indicates an early return in a function that doesn't return any value (`fn(): void`), while the second one indicates a function that explicitly return the `undefined` value (`fn(): something | undefined`).
For example cases like this looks totally fine to me:

```js
export function literalVal(literal: Literal): LiteralVal {
    switch (literal.type) {
        case "bigint":
            return BigInt(literal.val)
        case "number":
        case "string":
            return literal.val
        case "false":
            return false
        case "null":
            return null
        case "true":
            return true
        case "undefined":
            return undefined
    }
}
```

However, this could make the rule very different from its unicorn source.

Also, `useGetterReturn` doesn't accept `return;`, only `return <something>`, including `return undefined` that got flagged by `noUselessUndefined`.
Yes, I also agree to that. So, noUselessUndefined would only check parameters I guess.

issueDTO.title: Analytics page fix
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹 Currently, on the analytics page, if no one has connected their wallet, the graph remains empty without any indication. This can be confusing for users. Instead, we should display a small message like: **"No user has connected their wallet at the moment."** ## Proposed Actions 🛠️ Here’s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue: 1. **Fork and Create Branch**: Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number: ```bash git checkout -b fix-[issue-number] ``` 2. **Implement Changes**: - [ ] Modify the component that renders the analytics graph. - [ ] Add a conditional check to determine if there is wallet data. - [ ] If there is no data, display a centered message: **"No user has connected their wallet at the moment."** - [ ] Ensure the message is styled appropriately for visibility. - [ ] If data exists, display the graph as usual. Example code snippet: ```jsx {walletData.length === 0 ? (
No user has connected their wallet at the moment.
) : ( )} ``` 3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**: Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message: ```bash git commit -m "Fix: Show message when no wallet is connected on analytics page" ``` ## Required 📋 To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines: - **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren’t assigned to this issue. - **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**. - **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing Close #[issue_id]. - **Review Process**: - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**. - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done. - **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing. Thank you for your contribution 🙏 ⚠️ WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: [Variant] Tests for creating "large" `VariantObjects`s
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem or challenge? Please describe what you are trying to do.**
- part of https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/issues/6736

The [Variant](https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/VariantEncoding.md#encoding-types) encoding uses different sizes for offsets in nested types to optimize the encoding size

Specifically
* Objects [use between 1-4 bytes for the field id depending on the number of fields](https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/VariantEncoding.md#value-header-for-object-basic_type2)
* Objects [use between 1-4 bytes for the field offset depending on the size of the children](https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/VariantEncoding.md#value-header-for-object-basic_type2)


**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like tests that use the `VariantBuilder` API and cover the following cases:
1. `VariantObject` with between 2^8 and 2^16 elements ( `field_id_size_minus_1` = 1, 2 byte field ids)
2. `VariantObject` with between 2^16 and 2^24 elements ( `field_id_size_minus_1` = 2, 3 byte field ids)
3. `VariantObject` with between 2^24 and 2^32 elements ( `field_id_size_minus_1` = 3, 4 byte field ids)

1. `VariantObject` with total child data length between 2^8 and 2^16 elements ( `field_offset_size_minus_1` = 1, 2 byte field offsets)
2. `VariantObject` with total child data length between 2^16 and 2^24 elements ( `field_offset_size_minus_1` = 2, 3 byte field offsets)
3. `VariantObject` with total child data length between 2^24 and 2^32 elements ( `field_offset_size_minus_1` = 3, 4 byte field offsets)

The "total child data length" can be made by adding some large strings as children (for example, by adding 1KB - 1MB `Varaint::String`s via `ArrayBuilder::append`)


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
-->

**Additional context**
The tests may not pass until this ticket is implemented:
- https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/issues/7699

If they dont' pass, we can mark them `#[ignored]` until it is

summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by writing tests using the `VariantBuilder` API and covering the following cases: 1. `VariantObject` with between 2^8 and 2^16 elements, 2. `VariantObject` with between 2^16 and 2^24 elements, 3. `VariantObject` with between 2^24 and 2^32 elements, and so on.

issueDTO.title: [Variant] Tests for creating "large" `VariantList`s
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem or challenge? Please describe what you are trying to do.**
- part of https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/issues/6736

The [Variant](https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/VariantEncoding.md#encoding-types) encoding uses different sizes for offsets in nested types to optimize the encoding size

Specifically
* Arrays (`VariantList`) [use 1 byte and 4 bytes for length when the list has <=256 and >256 list elements respectively](https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/VariantEncoding.md#value-header-for-array-basic_type3)
* Arrays (`VariantList`) [use 1 byte and 4 bytes for the offset depending on how large the total variant payload size is](https://github.com/apache/parquet-format/blob/master/VariantEncoding.md#value-header-for-array-basic_type3)


**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like tests that use the `VariantBuilder` API and cover the following cases:
1. `VariantList` with more than 256 elements
2. `VariantList` with total child data length between 2^8 and 2^16 ( `field_offset_size_minus_1` = 1, 2 byte offsets)
2. `VariantList` with total child data length between 2^16 and 2^24 ( `field_offset_size_minus_1` = 2, 3 byte offsets)
2. `VariantList` with total child data length between 2^24 and 2^32 ( `field_offset_size_minus_1` = 3, 4 byte offsets)

The "total child data length" can be made by adding some large strings as children (for example, by adding 1KB - 1MB `Varaint::String`s via `ListBuilder::append`)

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
-->

**Additional context**
The tests may not pass until this ticket is implemented:
- https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/issues/7699

If they dont' pass, we can mark them `#[ignored]` until it is

issueDTO.title: Allow setting max filesize for archived webpages
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the feature you'd like

Please add a config value/environment variable to enforce a max filesize for archived webpages.  If this size is exceeded, Karakeep should discard the webpage.


### Describe the benefits this would bring to existing Karakeep users

Some large or media rich websites will create extremely large archive files, some 1GB+: https://github.com/karakeep-app/karakeep/issues/770
This takes up significant storage and doesn't end up rendering in browsers anyways, it just causes hangs/crashes when opened.

### Can the goal of this request already be achieved via other means?

Not automatically, you would have to manually purge all assets above a certain filesize in settings.

### Have you searched for an existing open/closed issue?

- [x] I have searched for existing issues and none cover my fundamental request

### Additional context

https://github.com/karakeep-app/karakeep/issues/770

issueDTO.title: JWT & Wallet Token Verification
issueDTO.description:
Create a standalone `TokenVerificationModule` that handles all token-related logic separately from the existing `AuthModule`. This module should abstract JWT and wallet token verification, allowing any part of the application to plug in and use its services without needing to depend on authentication business logic.

The goal is to make this module reusable across different parts of the application or even other projects.

### ✅ Tasks:

* Set up a new `TokenVerificationModule`
* Implement a `VerificationService` to handle:

  * JWT token validation
  * Wallet token validation
* Create reusable guards (e.g., `JwtGuard`, `WalletGuard`) for route protection
* Add interceptors if needed (e.g., token-based logging, header manipulation)
* Ensure the module has no dependencies on `AuthModule`

### 📦 Notes:

* This module must be self-contained.
* It should be easy to import and use in any feature module without coupling to user logic, roles, or database interactions.

issueDTO.title: Create a Migration module to handle data migration to db
issueDTO.description:
A standalone utility MigrationModule designed to simplify the process of syncing or migrating puzzle data from `.json` or external sources directly into the database. This module includes a JSON parser service and a secure upload endpoint for admins.

**🎯 Goals:**
Enable administrators to seamlessly upload and parse external puzzle data (like `.json` files), and persist them into the existing DB structure as puzzle entities.

---

### ✅ Tasks:

* **Create MigrationModule**

  * Standalone NestJS module with its own services and controller
* **Build JSON Parser Service**

  * Converts uploaded `.json` file data into puzzle DB entities
  * Handles validation and error reporting
* **Create Upload Endpoint**

  * Accepts `.json` file uploads
  * Triggers parsing and saving of puzzle data

issueDTO.title: Refactoring for Unit Test Access Controls
issueDTO.description:
Part of #12048

## Issue
After most of the Unit Test migration in #12048, there are a lot of inconsistencies in access control test methods. This is because we did not migrate the many convenient, abstracted, and commonly used access control test methods from `ui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java` to `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`.

After merging #13254, all of the access control test methods in `BaseActionTest.java` have been migrated. Hence, this issue aims to refactor the unit test access controls to use these convenient test methods.

## Progress
The progress for this refactoring can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IcB-viJMrIOknYoBYasBuRBK9qnwY0-doEK4_Eb24IA/edit?gid=0#gid=0).

## Steps to Contribute

1. Choose test(s) to work on in the above Google Sheets link, and comment on this issue to indicate that you'd like to contribute on the chosen test(s).
2. Create a PR to refactor the unit test(s).
3. Submit the PR, with a link to this issue by starting the description with "Part of #13304"

## Tips

- Understand the access control test methods in `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`, follow the refactoring in #13254
- Most of the access control testing logic in the migrated unit tests under `sqlui/webapi` follows the old unit tests under `ui/webapi`, so you may wish to reference the old unit test for help

issueDTO.title: Issues with 3rd party compilation order
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Manually compiling Multipass the build process stops at some point.

**To Reproduce**
Inside one Ubuntu 20.04 container, the build process compiling with CLang stops with this error:
```
-- Looking for openssl/des.h - not found
CMake Error at 3rd-party/libssh/libssh/ConfigureChecks.cmake:80 (message):
  Could not detect openssl/des.h
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  3rd-party/libssh/CMakeLists.txt:51 (include)
```

**Expected behavior**
The problem seems to be related to the _order_ of the 3rd party components:
https://github.com/canonical/multipass/blob/6c4b8b4f23462a58c81b708808782e682627bf9b/CMakeLists.txt#L125-L138

If you check the pre-builded `vcpkg-ports` 3rd party package, it includes custom `grpc` and `poco` packages as well. However, the configuration is not using these libs to compile other 3rd party packages. And the same is true for the `libssh`.

The idea is then: compile first custom `libssh`, `grpc` and `poco`; and after use _only_ these versions to compile all the other dependencies.

I hope you want to improve the compilation process to reduce dependencies and use _only_ the custom build 3rd party libraries. This could facilitate compilation in other environments and reduce compilation time.
comments:
Hi @lars18th , thanks for bringing this to our attention, it's definitely worth exploring further to simplify and improve the build process and, possibly, the build instructions. 
Since you seem to have investigated the problem and possible solutions, feel free to open a PR and suggest a fix, we're always happy to review and incorporate contributions from the community.
Hello! Is there any way I could contribute to this issue?

Hi @ljonathan0719. Yes, we welcome community contributions, so you can submit a pull request! I suggest starting by finding a simple recipe to reproduce the issue and take it from there (if you haven't yet). Thank you for your interest and let us know if you need further guidance.
Hi @ricab , is this issue still up for grabs? Or is someone working on it?
@ljonathan0719 do you mean to pursue #3939 any further? If not, I guess this would be free @SuhasHareesh.

I think you need to use `add_dependencies(...)` to build in a specific order
[add_dependencies](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/command/add_dependencies.html)

I don't see movement here for a while.
I'm working on this.
Why this issue is relevant? I don't have this problem compiling in the latest ubuntu LTS. And this is a no longer supported version.

> Why this issue is relevant? 

Because we want to compile in _any_ Linux (compatible) environment, not only in supported versions.

Please, try to think on this:

- _Why do we need 3party libraries if we compile for a _specific_ Linux distribution?_
 In this case, the correct strategy would be to install the 3party library on the system and compile with it.

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Bug Report: All Users.CreateUser... endpoints return a vague server error is null name is provided
issueDTO.description:
### 👟 Reproduction steps

POST to /v1/users or any of the "create user with ___ password" endpoints
Create body with a defined UserId, and a `name: null`.
Observe the vague server error

### 👍 Expected behavior

No server error, should continue creating the user with no name. Name is optional anyway, so specifying it as null should not create this error.

### 👎 Actual Behavior

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/835e2c3f-dd8b-453d-8d61-2c6a85a0d1ec)


### 🎲 Appwrite version

Appwrite Cloud

### 💻 Operating system

Windows

### 🧱 Your Environment

I am developing my own SDK, hence running into this issue. I can work around it of course, but there shouldn't be a reason for this to occur in the first place. I have replicated it using postman to eliminate any possible issues at a deeper level within my own SDK.

Wasn't sure if you would care about this sort of issue, but received no answer on Discord as to whether to file this or not.

### 👀 Have you spent some time to check if this issue has been raised before?

- [x] I checked and didn't find similar issue

### 🏢 Have you read the Code of Conduct?

- [x] I have read the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/appwrite/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
comments:
Looks like the error in the backend is:

```
{closure}(): Argument #5 ($name) must be of type string, null given, called in /usr/src/code/vendor/utopia-php/framework/src/App.php on line 531
```

because `$name` is supposed to be a string and not null here:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/a49c3a33f0fd831423afa7a0b53df2c5d709fc2b/app/controllers/api/users.php#L207

There's a Text validator here:

https://github.com/appwrite/appwrite/blob/a49c3a33f0fd831423afa7a0b53df2c5d709fc2b/app/controllers/api/users.php#L201

but it seems like it doesn't run when the [param is optional and the value is null](https://github.com/utopia-php/servers/blob/fd5c8d32778f265256c1936372a071b944f5ba8a/src/Servers/Base.php#L293-L295).

We should probably make the param nullable and if null was passed, create the user with empty string for name.
Hey, I am new to open source would really like to contribute to this issue. I have worked with PHP before and I could leverage my experience to get a hang about the issue.

Have just noticed the same issue is also present on [Create User Target](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/1.6.x/server-rest/users#createTarget) also - However this effects both the `name` property as well as the `providerId`. If either are sent as null the same thing happens.
Similarly, for [Update User Target](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/1.6.x/server-rest/users#updateTarget) also, for `name`, `providerId`, as well as `identifier` too.

[Create Token](https://appwrite.io/docs/references/1.6.x/server-rest/users#createToken) also has this issue, for both `length` and `expire`.

I've already completed the Account API and didn't run into this issue there at all. Either I'm doing something different now, or the issue isn't present in the Account API endpoints for some strange reason.

@vaifai, are you still interested in working on this?

issueDTO.title: SessionModule for Tracking Active User Sessions
issueDTO.description:
Implement a standalone `SessionModule` to track active sessions of players during puzzle rounds or quiz engagements. This module should handle session creation, termination, and automatic cleanup of expired sessions. It should not rely on any other module in the project and must be easily pluggable or testable in isolation.

---

### 📌 Tasks:

* [ ] Create a `Session` entity with the following fields:

  * `sessionId` (UUID)
  * `userId` (string or UUID)
  * `activityType` (enum or string: e.g., 'puzzle', 'quiz')
  * `startedAt` (Date)
  * `endedAt` (Date | nullable)

* [ ] Implement logic to:

  * [ ] Start a session and persist it to the database
  * [ ] End a session and update its `endedAt` timestamp

* [ ] Add automatic cleanup for expired sessions using:

  * [ ] Cron job (e.g., every hour), **or**
  * [ ] TTL-based cleanup if using a TTL-capable storage like Redis or MongoDB

* [ ] Ensure no imports or tight coupling from other modules like UserModule or PuzzleModule
comments:
I'm would like to build a clean, standalone SessionModule that efficiently manages player sessions with support for automatic cleanup and full testability. With experience in designing modular systems and cron/TTL cleanup strategies, I'm confident in delivering a robust and decoupled solution.

## Evergreens

issueDTO.title: Add UI backdrop opacity control
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
F3D has a simple ImGui based UI which feature a backdrop for readability.
However this backdrop opacity is hardcode to 0.35, which may make the text unreadable depending on the background or HDRI.

F3D used to adapt text color automatically but this is not the case anymore as the backdrop makes the text readable at all time. But it would be nice to provide a way to control the opacity of the backdrop.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Remove the non-functionnal "IsBackgroundDark" logic and associated tests
 - Add a libf3d option and CLI option `ui.backdrop.opacity`
 - Implement the logic to control the opacity in vtkF3DUIActor, vtkF3DImGUIActor and vtkF3DRenderer
 - Add testing and doc

repository.description: Fast and minimalist 3D viewer.
repository.name: f3d

summary.main: The issue is about adding a UI backdrop opacity control to F3D, a simple ImGui based UI, to make the text readable by allowing users to adjust the opacity of the backdrop.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is to provide a way to control the opacity of the backdrop, ensuring that the text remains readable regardless of the background or HDRI.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by removing non-functional 'IsBackgroundDark' logic and associated tests, adding a libf3d option and CLI option 'ui.backdrop.opacity', implementing the opacity control logic in vtkF3DUIActor, vtkF3DImGUIActor, and vtkF3DRenderer, and adding testing and documentation.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'help wanted' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. The issue description provides a clear problem statement and a proposed solution.

issueDTO.title: [FR]: New Evaluaton Metric "LLM Sycophancy" (SycEval)
issueDTO.description:
### Proposal summary

We like to extend the existing LLM-as-a-judge evaluation metrics to include a new judge metric called "Sycophancy". Full paper with the methodology and prompts can be found here: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2502.08177

Example of an existing judge metric (Hallucination) is defined here:
- Docs: https://www.comet.com/docs/opik/evaluation/metrics/hallucination
- Docs Code: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-documentation/documentation/fern/docs/evaluation/metrics/hallucination.mdx
- Python SDK: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/tree/main/sdks/python/src/opik/evaluation/metrics/llm_judges/hallucination
- Python Examples: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/sdks/python/examples/metrics.py
- Frontend: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-frontend/src/constants/llm.ts

Expectation is the new judge is added to the frontend for using LLM-as-a-judge from the UI (Online Evaluation tab) as well as in the Python SDK. The appropriate docs needs to be updated and a video attached of the metric working.

### Motivation

I would like to see more robust set of metrics and evaluations based on recent research
comments:

/bounty 25

## 💎 $25 bounty [• Comet](https://algora.io/comet-ml)
#### Steps to solve:
1. **Read Contributing Docs**: See [contributing guide](https://www.comet.com/docs/opik/contributing/overview) and read on how to setup Opik and contribute to various parts of the code base.
1. **Start working**: Comment `/attempt #2520` with your implementation plan
2. **Submit work**: Create a pull request including `/claim #2520` in the PR body to claim the bounty
4. **Review**: Team will review PR and any clarifying questions and if successful changes will be merged
3. **Receive payment**: 100% of the bounty is received 2-5 days post-reward. [Make sure you are eligible for payouts](https://algora.io/docs/payments#supported-countries-regions)

#### ❗ Important guidelines:
- Do NOT start multiple bounties
- To claim a bounty, you need to **provide a short demo video** of your changes in your pull request
- If anything is unclear, **ask for clarification** before starting as this will help avoid potential rework
- Low quality AI PRs will not receive review and will be closed
- Please ask to be assigned before attempting to work on the bounty

Thank you for contributing to Comet!

| Attempt | Started (UTC) | Solution | Actions |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 🟢 @mukulpythondev | Jun 22, 2025, 03:18:56 AM | WIP |  |
| 🟢 @yashkumar2603 | Jun 29, 2025, 08:04:23 AM | WIP |  |
/attempt #2520

/attempt #2520

My implementation plan is :
- Create a similar folder structure as hallucination metric in `sdks/python/src/opik/evaluation/metrics/llm_judges/` named `/syc_eval`.
- Follow similar code structuring as hallucination metric and create files in which the rebuttal mechanism will be written.
- The key innovation in the paper is to categorize the sycophancy into Progressive and Regressive sycophancy.
- Four rebuttal strength levels will be configured : simple, ethos, justification, citation.
- the evaluation will be a 2-step process with initial response evaluation and then rebuttal response evaluation.
- then we calculate overall sycophancy rates, progressive rates, and regressive rates. Creating detailed breakdown by rebuttal type and context mode.

Then the FE integration will be proceeded with :
- configure the UI components for configuring SycEval parameters on FE. Including toggles/selection for different rebuttal types and strengths
- Add context mode selection (radio buttons or dropdown)

Let me know thoughts and inputs on this, I am starting to work on it, I already did setup the codebase locally. Hoping to make meaningful contributions ✌ .

issueDTO.title: Negative rewards
issueDTO.description: When specifying negative rewards in a PRISM model, there is no error message but weird values are computed. According to Christian Hensel, negative rewards shall never be specified.
comments:
This occurs with sparse model building.
I propose that at leat with the option -ec this needs to be checked, and possibly in debug mode before model checking. 

As the issue has been around for ages and this is the only report about this problem, I do not think it is urgent. I therefore label it as a good first issue and defer solving it to someone working on the model builder. 

For the symbolic model building, there is a warning. We might want to make this an error.
@tquatmann I think this earlier statement by @cdehnert is no longer adequate, is it? Do we check anywhere later that all rewards are non-negative for those algorithms that need it?

summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by checking for negative rewards in the PRISM model and providing an error message when specified. This might involve adding a validation step during model building, especially with the option -ec and possibly in debug mode.

issueDTO.title: Feature Request: Friend Requests & Friends-Only Chat List
issueDTO.description:
### **📌 Feature Request: Friend Requests & Friends-Only Chat List 🤝**  

#### **Description**  
Implement a **Friend Request System** in **ZeenChat**, allowing users to:  
✅ **Send friend requests** to other users  
✅ **Receive and view pending friend requests**  
✅ **Accept or decline friend requests**  
✅ **Chat only with accepted friends** (hide non-friends from the chat list)  

#### **Why is this needed?**  
🔹 Prevents spam by limiting chats to friends only  
🔹 Makes the chat experience more personal and secure  
🔹 Enhances user engagement and interaction  

---

### **Suggested Approach**  

#### **1️⃣ Backend (Django & Database Updates)**  
- Create a **Friendship model** (`FriendRequest`) to store request statuses (`pending`, `accepted`, `declined`).  
- Update database queries to **only show accepted friends** in the chat list.  

#### **2️⃣ Frontend (JavaScript & UI Updates)**  
- Add a **"Friends" tab** to view pending requests.  
- Show **"Add Friend"** and **"Accept / Decline"** buttons.  
- Display only **accepted friends** in the chat list.  
(The notification icon already exists as commented out part inside the navbar)

---

### **🗂 Relevant Files**  
📂 `chatapp/models.py` – Add FriendRequest model  
📂 `chatapp/views.py` – Implement request handling  
📂 `chatapp/templates/chatapp/chat.html` – Add friend request UI  
📂 `chatapp/static/js/chat.js` – Handle friend-related interactions  

---

### **🚀 Want to Contribute?**  
Comment below if you're interested! We'll guide you through the process. 😊  

#### **Labels:**  
🔹 `enhancement` `good first issue`

issueDTO.title: tree-sitter-nim inclusion
issueDTO.description:
I recently stumbled upon aider and read that it "...relies on tree-sitter-language-pack to provide pre-packaged versions of tree-sitter language parsers." Unfortunately, a tree-sitter-nim hasn't been included yet.

I found [a forum topic](https://forum.nim-lang.org/t/10214) that linked to three different github repos:

- https://github.com/alaviss/tree-sitter-nim ([some discussion](https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/discussions/2248))
- https://github.com/aMOPel/tree-sitter-nim
- https://github.com/paranim/tree-sitter-nim

Can any of these be included? Would the authors of these need to be involved? I'm fairly clueless on this topic, so I'm just hoping for some pointers on what it would take to get this done.
comments:
Hi there. 

This package is not affiliated with Aider, although Aider relies on it. 

Anyhow, a PR adding NIM Grammer is welcome. 

It looks like just one of these repos is maintained. Id suggest you try adding this one. Contributions welcome.
@alaviss Do you think your tree-sitter-nim is ready for inclusion in this pack? And are you willing to make that happen?

I'm not quite sure what constitutes "ready" in this case, but the parser is quite stable and has been a part of nvim-treesitter, helix editor and zed editor for awhile now.

I will not partake in adding the parser to this repository myself, so either you or someone else would have to do it. However, should there be difficulties in building or using the parser, you can open an issue and I would be happy to assist.
@Goldziher I would love to add tree-sitter-nim support and might as well add the support to *[uncomment](https://github.com/Goldziher/uncomment)*.

@Abdulrasheed1729 i had to remove the zig support for now. The issue is that you added it as a repo dependency, and we cant bundle and pubiosh to cargo like this. 

Check that nim is installable using cargo please.

Okay, I noticed tree-sitter-nim is not on crates.io and PyPI. Though for the ZIg, it's on cargo but the grammar does not match the current Zig doc comment grammar, that's why I had to create a fork and make some changes before the opened PR is accepted.
sorry @Abdulrasheed1729 - its fine to add nim, but is it open source. Sorry, wrong repository.

issueDTO.title: GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT env var
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

Failed to login. Message: This account requires setting the GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT env var. See            │
│ https://goo.gle/gemini-cli-auth-docs#workspace-gca

Do i need to set this variable every single time in using cli? i tired of login multiple time

### What did you expect to happen?

Just login once and use it forever


### Client information

<details>

Login with Google

</details>


### Login information

Login with Google

### Anything else we need to know?

_No response_
comments: Would be great if we can add it to `settings.json` since I use different google cloud projects for different things and don't want to set it up globally in env

Allowing this to be set in settings.json as well as an environment variable is a good idea. There are existing examples of other settings that are settable in both places. I would expect Gemini CLI would be able to pretty much do all the work of adding this feature if someone wants to give it a try.
Can i work on this?
same issue

Gemini CLI already supports persisting it (and other keys) in a .env file. Using settings.json for environment variables is not recommended because that file is intended for CLI configuration, not secrets. The documentation has been updated here https://github.com/google-gemini/gemini-cli/pull/2402/files to explain how it works.

@jarvisphere Many developers work with multiple `Google Cloud projects`. Constantly setting the `GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT` environment variable for each session or each project is not user friendly. So I believe, allowing it to be configured in a `settings.json` file provides a much more persistent and convenient way to manage this.

@santhoshkumarCodes configuration in settings.json isn't a good approach for these 2 reasons
1. It's a configuration file and shouldn't have environment variables. 
2. The developer will have to change the settings value every time they switch between projects, which isn't ideal, and sometimes they might end up using the key of another project by mistake. Each project should have its own .env file

You don't have to set the environment variables for each session if there is a `.gemini/.env` file either at the project level (recommended) or at home dir: `~/.gemini/.env`

@jarvisphere Now I've refactored my PR to follow this order of precedence:

   1. Environment Variable: The GOOGLE_CLOUD_PROJECT environment variable
      is checked first and used if set.
   2. Project Settings: If the environment variable is not present, the CLI
       looks for a gcpProjectId in the project-specific
      .gemini/settings.json.
   3. User Settings: If neither of the above is found, it falls back to the
       gcpProjectId in the global ~/.gemini/settings.json.

I think this will do good!
Quick question, i'm paying for Gemini Pro on Workspace, why do i need GoogleCloudProject env var? Will this mean that charges for t he usage are then billed through that GoogleCloudProject?

issueDTO.title: Log URL redirecting to No XCom error
issueDTO.description:
### Apache Airflow version

Other Airflow 2 version (please specify below)

### If "Other Airflow 2 version" selected, which one?

2.10.1

### What happened?

The Log URL (`ti.log_url`) from the triggered retry email doesn't redirect to the Logs when clicked but instead shows 'No XCom' as the error in the Airflow UI. The Logs are shown when a time in future is selected as the `base_date` in the UI.

Before changing the base_date in the UI,

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6a4a2edd-a2c6-42ca-95d2-6315ba4acc48)

After adding 1 second to the base_date in UI,

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7cc6af14-92f9-46e0-8ac8-7abc63abaf54)




### What you think should happen instead?

I think the issue might be due to milli seconds getting truncated which causes the difference between the execution datetime (untruncated) and the execution datetime rendered - `base_date` (truncated) in the `ti.log_url`

### How to reproduce

Here is the DAG to reproduce the issue,

```
from airflow.decorators import dag, task
from datetime import datetime, timedelta

@dag(
    dag_id='default_email_on_retry_example',
    schedule_interval='@once',
    start_date=datetime(2023, 1, 1),
    catchup=False,
    default_args={
        'email': ['your@email.com'],  
        'email_on_retry': True,  
        'email_on_failure': False,  
    },
)
def default_email_on_retry_dag():

    @task
    def success_task():
        print("This task will always succeed!")

    @task(task_id='retry_task', retries=3, retry_delay=timedelta(seconds=15))
    def retry_task():
        print("This task will retry and fail.")
        raise Exception("Simulated task failure for retry.")

    success = success_task()
    retry = retry_task()

    success >> retry

default_email_on_retry_dag()
```

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b6394374-69cf-4d88-bc6d-6154e8ef9ecb)

Click the Log `Link` from the email triggered by the DAG

### Operating System

Linux

### Versions of Apache Airflow Providers

_No response_

### Deployment

Amazon (AWS) MWAA

### Deployment details

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

issueDTO.title: Allow Users to Share Feedback

Implement a standalone FeedbackModule system that lets users submit their thoughts on puzzles, the app experience, or educational content. Users can choose to remain anonymous. Admins should have full access to view and manage all submitted feedback.

---

* Create a `Feedback` entity with the following fields:

  * `id`: primary key
  * `rating`: number (1–5)
  * `comment`: string (optional)
  * `targetType`: enum (`Puzzle`, `App`, `Education`)
  * `isAnonymous`: boolean (default: false)
  * `createdAt`: timestamp
* Create a POST endpoint: `/feedback`

  * Accepts feedback with or without user info (depending on `isAnonymous`)
* Create a GET endpoint: `/feedback/admin`

  * Accessible only by admins
  * Returns all feedback entries

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Bug Report: JWT still valid after Session Timeout
issueDTO.description:
### 👟 Reproduction steps

I use JWT to authenticate a user on my API server. I use the /account endpoint to verify the JWT. If the user is logged out because the session has expired, the JWT is still valid and I still get a successful response when I call /account with the user's JWT.

### 👍 Expected behavior

The JWT should be invalid after the user is logged out and calling /account with users JWT should throw an error.

### 👎 Actual Behavior

Calling /account with the users JWT gives a successful response.

Discord thread: https://discord.com/channels/564160730845151244/1221805690050445362

Version 1.4.x

Linux

I use Self-Hosted Appwrite Version 1.4.13

issueDTO.title: Support Arrow Flight SQL
issueDTO.description:
We would like to support Arrow Flight SQL as an alternative protocol to Spark Connect. This would allow integration with SQL clients (e.g. BI tools) outside of PySpark. The user would be able to start the server via something like `sail flight server` in the command line.

Using the [Arrow Flight SQL JDBC Driver](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/flight_sql_jdbc_driver.html), Java applications can connect to Sail via `jdbc:arrow-flight-sql://`. This is similar to how the [Spark Thrift Server](https://www.russellspitzer.com/2017/05/19/Spark-Sql-Thriftserver/) allows connection via `jdbc:hive2://`.

(As far as I can tell, the Spark Thrift Server uses the JDBC protocol, and do not use Apache Thrift.)

Ballista used to support Arrow Flight SQL (~1,000 LoC) but the functionality has been removed (<https://github.com/apache/datafusion-ballista/pull/1228>). I expect the effort would be similar in Sail. The design should be straightforward and not too much knowledge of Sail internals is required.
comments:
I've worked quite a bit with raw arrow tables so I'd like to take a crack at this if possible?

I mainly use Go but I've built small things in rust.

> 
> I mainly use Go but I've built small things in rust.

Please feel free to take a crack at this issue. If you have any questions about the codebase or need any help getting started, do not hesitate to ask. We are happy to help along the way!

issueDTO.title: feature: Drag on input to change numberical values
issueDTO.description:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

Adjusting numbers for which there is no-direct input control is tedious; Numbers must be entered manually or increased/decreased with the arrow keys. 

(Direct input control would be positioning by drag and drop; no direct input control is anything that needs to be changes in the GUI and not on the canvas, like opacity or blur)

### Describe the solution you'd like.

Allow drag-to-change-value on numeric input fields. This means if you mousedown in an input field and drag right the value is increased, if you drag left, the value is decreased (for left-to-right languages at least, otherwise protentially reversed). The amount of value change is proportional to the drag distance (as if you would drag an invisible slider which is initially positioned at the drag start point)

* Figma has a working solution on this if you want to see it in action:
![animation: drag on numerical control to change number](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3416487/196199679-3c467e25-227c-4220-922d-844361d97757.gif)



### Describe alternatives you've considered.

* #1831 describes using something like GIMPs numeric controls which are similar to sliders which are more easy to hit with the mouse. This needs far more space than a single numberical control, though. The OP mentiones the solution described here in a comment. 
* Just having the conventional Up/down mini-arrows would enable mouse interaction for what is now up/down arrow keys: ![up/down mini buttons for numerical input](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3416487/196196695-5540f915-19a0-495a-a7e9-de8cb215bcd8.png)


### Additional context
* Via Casey Dalbo’s reply to [this penpot thread](https://twitter.com/CaseyDalbo/status/1581987007818911744)
comments:
Without a doubt, this feature would be very useful. We already have this [User Story in Taiga](https://tree.taiga.io/project/penpot/us/4080) to manage and prioritize it.

Thank you!

I have a quick fix that works but has two major issues which require a bit of work. Maybe I'll have some more time in a week or so, but maybe not, so I'm leaving this here in case someone wants to give it a go in a few weeks: ask first because I will have some usable code.

* The way that cursors are handled overall makes it so that as soon as one moves out of the input field, it is reset to whatever (e.g. the custom arrow in the canvas), which is very ugly. One fix would be to keep a global cursor stream and use that in every component that currently sets the cursor locally.
* Each in/decrement of the field triggers an update for the undo stack, immediately making it unusable with hundreds of changes. This follows the behaviour with the mouse wheel, but we should change that too: updates should be grouped and made into atomic changes. Both can be addressed at the same time.

Just an update for the record while we work on merging #6635 

> * The way that cursors are handled ...

After implementing pointer warping (i.e. pop it on the opposite side of the window when we hit the border, as if it moved over a torus) this is solved because the default pointer is hidden by the browser when capturing it (which is required for the warping)

> * Each in/decrement of the field triggers an update for the undo stack ...

This is solved with a wrapper component `transactional-input*`, a strategy hopefully useful for other components as well

issueDTO.title: Dashboard filters allow creating bi-directional dependencies in an unexpected way with value filters
issueDTO.description:
### Bug description

When configuring dashboard filters with the "Values are dependent on other filters" option, the system prevents creating bi-directional dependencies upfront by showing a "Cyclic dependency detected" message. However, it allows creating the same dependency indirectly after saving the initial filter configuration.

1. If Filter A is set to depend on Filter B, the system blocks setting Filter B to depend on Filter A immediately, showing a "Cyclic dependency detected" message.
2. However, if Filter A is saved with the dependency on Filter B, the system later allows editing Filter B to create the reverse dependency, effectively forming a bi-directional (cyclic) dependency.

This behavior is inconsistent and might lead to unexpected filter behavior. It appears to contradict the intended prevention of cyclic dependencies.
How to reproduce the bug

1. Create a dashboard filter (e.g., Filter A) with a dependency on another filter (e.g., Filter B) by enabling the Values are dependent on other filters option.
2. Save the filter configuration.
3. Open the dashboard filter configuration again, select Filter B, and set it to depend on Filter A.
4. Save the changes.

## Expected results

The system should prevent bi-directional (cyclic) dependencies for all filter types, not just date filters. Users should not be able to create a cyclic dependency by editing the filters after saving the initial configuration.

## Actual results

The platform allows creating cyclic dependencies indirectly after the initial configuration, even though it prevents it upfront. This behavior is inconsistent and may lead to unexpected filter behavior.

### Screenshots/recordings

_No response_

### Superset version

master / latest-dev

### Python version

3.11

### Node version

18 or greater

### Browser

Chrome

### Additional context

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched Superset docs and Slack and didn't find a solution to my problem.
- [x] I have searched the GitHub issue tracker and didn't find a similar bug report.
- [x] I have checked Superset's logs for errors and if I found a relevant Python stacktrace, I included it here as text in the "additional context" section.

issueDTO.title: libc: implement `getc()`
issueDTO.description:
This was originally added as a ticket under POSIX, but `getc()` is not a POSIX function. It is from C89.

https://en.cppreference.com/w/c/io/fgetc

The expectation from the POSIX API is that this function is implemented as part of whatever C library is in use.
comments: Is this not already in the minimal libc??
Hej @ycsin, @cfriedt, If this issue is not worked, I would like to take this. It would be helpful if you can guide and share some reference about this issue.

> I would like to take this. It would be helpful if you can guide and share some reference about this issue.

Hi @00thirdeye00 - `getc(FILE *stream)` shouldn't be too difficult.

From a very high level, it should be as simple as 
1. lock the fdtable entry associated with `stream` (and verify that it is valid)
2. read a character and report it back, or `EOF` if there is an error.
3. unlock the fdtable entry

Do we still have `zvfs_read()` or was that reverted? With that, it would be trivial to implement.
@cfriedt hej, thank you, since i am new to zephyr, it can be helpful if you can provide any references to files, implementation and flow

@00thirdeye00 -

lib/os/fdtable.c <-- ftdable and some ZVFS functions
lib/c_lib/common/ <-- common libc components

https://docs.zephyrproject.org/latest/contribute/index.html

def test(): pass

When enabled, all non-admin routes should be blocked, preventing user access while maintenance is ongoing. The module should use a configuration entity or environment flag and expose an admin-only route to toggle the mode.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Create configuration entity or use environment variable for maintenance mode status
* [ ] Implement a global guard to block access to all routes except admin when maintenance mode is active
* [ ] Develop an admin-only API route to toggle maintenance mode on and off

issueDTO.title: [重要]关于CDN缓存的说明（删除、拉黑等操作延迟生效解决方案）
issueDTO.description:
为了尽量**减少外部请求回源的次数**，优化使用体验，本项目对正常读取、404、Block等情况设置了从4小时到1年不等的CDN缓存时间。
因此，在不进行任何配置的情况下，删除、拉黑、加白名单等操作不会立即生效，必须**等CDN中缓存到期才能生效**。

## 如果您期望这些操作立即生效，请依据**文档**`3.1.3.9管理端删除、拉黑等操作优化`节进行相关环境变量配置，配置成功后，**相关操作立即生效**，本地浏览器如果没有生效，可以通过`Ctrl-F5`强制刷新生效。

issueDTO.title: Increase Pylint Score for the current codebase
issueDTO.description:
# Improve Pylint Coverage and Code Quality in EvalAI

## Description
We recently added pylint to our CI pipeline with a minimum score requirement of 5.0, but we need to improve our overall pylint score and fix common code quality issues throughout the codebase.

## Current Status
- Pylint has been integrated into our Travis CI pipeline
- Current pylint score is below the acceptable threshold :(
- Refer here: https://app.travis-ci.com/github/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/jobs/631902183
- Multiple error categories are being reported that need fixing

## Objectives
1. Identify and fix common pylint errors and warnings
2. Increase the overall pylint score from current level to at least 7.5
3. Standardize code quality across the codebase

## Proposed Tasks
- [ ] Address unused imports and variables (typically detected by C0410, W0611)
- [ ] Fix line length issues to comply with PEP 8 (79 characters)
- [ ] Add missing docstrings to modules, classes, and functions
- [ ] Fix poor variable naming and code style issues

1. First fix all error-level issues (--errors-only)
2. Then address warning-level issues
3. Finally work on convention and refactor messages
