issueDTO.description: ### Checks - [x] I have searched [github.com/aws/amazon-q-developer-cli/issues](https://github.com/aws/amazon-q-developer-cli/issues?q=) and there are no duplicates of my issue - [x] I have run `q doctor` in the affected terminal session - [x] I have run `q restart` and replicated the issue again ### Operating system macOS 15.3.1 (24D70) ### Expected behaviour When asking chat to debug a web application that involves running a local server, expected behavior is that chat runs a webserver, runs required checks, makes a decision that website responds as required, stops local server and continues with its decisions. ### Actual behaviour The current issue happens when "q chat" makes a decision to run a local server in a current terminal window. This sends the current terminal session into a "running server" mode and stops any further actions from q chat as it loses control over the terminal. Typing "y" or using "enter" do not affect anything. When using "CTRL+C", chat loses the chain of thought ### Steps to reproduce Ask to create a python flask application and then ask chat to debug the website to see if it works. ### Environment ```yaml [q-details] version = "1.7.2" hash = "b6bf5f1675dd7395009e8bc65c1145820671f211" date = "2025-03-21T01:36:16.66764Z (19h ago)" variant = "full" [system-info] os = "macOS 15.3.1 (24D70)" chip = "Apple M1 Pro" total-cores = 10 memory = "32.00 GB" [environment] cwd = "/Users/USER/Documents/aws/samples/q chat/personalize-casino-demo" cli-path = "/Users/USER/Documents/aws/samples/q chat/personalize-casino-demo" os = "Mac" shell-path = "/bin/zsh" shell-version = "5.9" terminal = "VSCode" install-method = "unknown" [env-vars] PATH = "/Users/USER/Documents/aws/samples/q chat/personalize-casino-demo/venv/bin:/opt/homebrew/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.12/bin:/usr/local/bin:/System/Cryptexes/App/usr/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/var/run/com.apple.security.cryptexd/codex.system/bootstrap/usr/local/bin:/var/run/com.apple.security.cryptexd/codex.system/bootstrap/usr/bin:/var/run/com.apple.security.cryptexd/codex.system/bootstrap/usr/appleinternal/bin:/Users/USER/.vscode/extensions/ms-python.python-2025.2.0-darwin-arm64/python_files/deactivate/zsh:/Users/USER/.pyenv/versions/3.8.12/bin:/opt/homebrew/bin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.12/bin:/Users/USER/.local/bin" QTERM_SESSION_ID = "38b2f8a58ec548a8b6e711aa74579a77" Q_SET_PARENT_CHECK = "1" Q_TERM = "1.7.1" SHELL = "/bin/zsh" TERM = "xterm-256color" ZDOTDIR = "/Users/USER" __CFBundleIdentifier = "com.microsoft.VSCode" ```

issueDTO.title: Drill to Detail is not working properly on Charts powered by Jinja Templating
issueDTO.description:
### Bug description

## Description
Dashboard charts that are powered by Jinja are able to display their data correctly. However, when users try to perform the drill-by action, the result is incorrect.

## How to reproduce the bug
1. By following [**this guide**](https://preset.io/blog/intro-jinja-templating-apache-superset/#using-jinja-to-filter-data-walkthrough), create a Jinja-powered dataset with `country`, `status`, and `product_line` columns.
2. Create a stacked Bar Chart and add it to a dashboard.
3. Add a filter for the Product Line from the `Vehicle Sales` dataset.
4. Ensure that the dashboard shows correct data.
5. On the stacked Bar Chart, perform a **drill to detail by all** action.

## Expected results
Drill-by results are correct.

## Actual results
Drill-by results are incorrect.

## Known Workarounds
No workarounds are currently known.


### Screenshots/recordings

_No response_

### Superset version

master / latest-dev

### Python version

3.9

### Node version

16

### Browser

Chrome

### Additional context

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched Superset docs and Slack and didn't find a solution to my problem.
- [x] I have searched the GitHub issue tracker and didn't find a similar bug report.
- [ ] I have checked Superset's logs for errors and if I found a relevant Python stacktrace, I included it here as text in the "additional context" section.
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This issue is caused by a disconnect between the context available to Jinja templates during regular chart rendering and what is provided during drill-to-detail actions. When you drill, the frontend sends a new request that often lacks the full dashboard/global context (like dashboard filters or URL params) that your Jinja SQL expects, so the template renders incorrectly or with missing values. This is a known limitation and has been discussed in several issues and code reviews ([example](https://github.com/apache/superset/issues/33591), [example](https://github.com/apache/superset/issues/33579)).

A workaround is to make your Jinja SQL more robust by using `if/else` blocks to provide default values when filters are missing, so the query always returns results and columns don't disappear. For example:

```sql
WITH calculation as (
  SELECT count(*), country
  FROM "Vehicle Sales"
  WHERE 1=1
  {% if filter_values('product_line') %}
    and product_line in {{ filter_values('product_line')|where_in }}
  {% else %}
    and product_line = 'Classic Cars'
  {% endif %}
  GROUP BY country
)
SELECT * FROM calculation
```
([source](https://github.com/apache/superset/issues/33591))

If your dataset relies on dashboard-level filters or variables, you may need to adjust your Jinja logic to handle cases where those are missing during drill actions.

There have also been recent changes to how Superset syncs dataset columns and processes Jinja templates, which can impact this behavior ([PR 30903](https://github.com/apache/superset/pull/30903)). Make sure your configuration enables `ENABLE_TEMPLATE_PROCESSING` and that your feature flags are up to date.

At this time, there is no full workaround for preserving all dashboard context in drill-to-detail requests, but making your Jinja SQL more defensive can help avoid empty or broken results.

issueDTO.title: Rewrite mockturtle to use IRCinch
issueDTO.description:
Our chat bot [mockturtle](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle) has languished because it's written in javascript and lives in another repo. Let's port to Ruby, run with the db available, and integrate with the site better, to add features like linking accounts. There's a gem called [IRCinch](https://github.com/ircinchrb/ircinch) that has a clear API and looks well-maintained.

As much as I want to list every feature I dream of, let's start with feature parity:

 - [ ] auth to libera and join `#lobsters`
 - [ ] [scheduled.js](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle/blob/develop/src/scheduled.js) on a timer to poll rss for commits
 - [ ] instead of a timer, create a background job for new stories. see plan for `mail_new_activity` in #1548 
 - [ ] post [titles](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle/blob/209656bc72236070a6efb0599d05d5f3c5e5a1bf/src/commands.js#L3-L18) for links that anyone shares in chat; note the [special-casing for youtube](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle/blob/209656bc72236070a6efb0599d05d5f3c5e5a1bf/src/index.js#L39-L57). This functionality is already in the Lobsters codebase, see `StoriesController#fetch_url_attributes`.
 - [ ] [salute](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle/blob/209656bc72236070a6efb0599d05d5f3c5e5a1bf/src/commands.js#L61-L70) a cute interaction
 - [ ] [seen](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle/blob/209656bc72236070a6efb0599d05d5f3c5e5a1bf/src/commands.js#L72-L93)
 - [ ] [tell](https://github.com/lobsters/mockturtle/blob/209656bc72236070a6efb0599d05d5f3c5e5a1bf/src/commands.js#L95-L119)
 - [ ] some tests of the above

After that we'll be ready to participate in the [venerable tradition](https://push.cx/discord-vs-irc-notes#:~:text=on%20features/services-,via%20chatbot,-is%20powerful%20but) of trying to fix IRC's deficiencies with chatbots.
comments: `walabaloo` in IRC volunteered to take this on, but I don't know their GitHub username to ping them.

I can't remember why I was looking at Ruby IRC bots within the last ~12 months, but I also settled on IRCinch as the "best" modern framework there was out there.

Happy to help out, review things towards the bot if needed. Written a few in my time, think only the [nwrug](https://nwrug.org) might still be running.
I'm grabbing this issue. I'll start knocking something together today.

I started https://github.com/caius/mockturble/tree/cd/initial-hello but then got distracted by Sorbet and life so haven't progressed it further. Definitely happy for others to overtake me and I'll just have yet another half-baked bot not finished 🙃

Should have a very basic MR ready to go tomorrow.
Scheduled.js is ported, just working on finishing commands.js and adding in telebugs support.

issueDTO.title: Port the code to C++11
issueDTO.description:
We recently moved to C++11 and big parts of the code are still using C++98 style.
This will be an ongoing task to port more and more parts of the code to C++11.

For example:
- ~~Use `nullptr` instead of `NULL`~~
- Use `auto` where possible
- Use `enum class` more
- Use range-based loops where possible
- Use `delete`, `default`, `override` where needed
- Use `unordered_map` instead of `map` for better performance
- etc.

**IMPORTANT:** this change can (and should) be done incrementally. Please try to open small PRs with not a lot of changes that are easy to review
comments: I'd like to help with this.

Not directly related with C++11 but also, library have some many C style casts, which can be easily located by using `cppcheck`. Anyone who wants fix them just remove or comment `cstyleCast:*` line from `cppcheckSuppressions.txt` and run `pre-commit run --all-files` or manually run `cppcheck` from command line.

Hi @seladb - I would like to collaborate on this task. Is there any task breakdown already or is there any progress?
Also, why porting to C++11 instead of later versions? (is it because the latest port you mention in your first comment was to C++11?

UPDATE - based on the Release notes (changes from v22.05) it seems this issue/ticket should be closed...

> Hi @seladb - I would like to collaborate on this task. Is there any task breakdown already or is there any progress? Also, why porting to C++11 instead of later versions? (is it because the latest port you mention in your first comment was to C++11?
> 
> UPDATE - based on the Release notes (changes from v22.05) it seems this issue/ticket should be closed...

Hi @jpcofr , thanks for offering your help! Actually, the reason this issue is still open is because this is an ongoing effort. We migrated to C++11 about a year ago, but a lot of the code base is still in C++98 style (definitely most of the code that was written more than a year ago). For example: we don't always use `auto` where needed, we still use `std::map` where we could use `std::unordered_map`, we don't use range-based loops in many cases, etc. We could use your help with those.

As I mentioned above - we don't expect a huge PR that fixes all of these things. We actually prefer small PRs that make incremental fixes, and we hope that we can slowly migrate as much of the code as possible.

It'd be really great if you can help. I'd like to thank you again and I'm looking forward to seeing your contributions! 🙏 🙏

>  be really great if you can help. 

@seladb ok I can collaborate. I am new to this repo so I need to check out how is everything working. What would be the next namespace/class etc. that you would like to be ported? I can start from there...

> > be really great if you can help.
> 
> @seladb ok I can collaborate. I am new to this repo so I need to check out how is everything working. What would be the next namespace/class etc. that you would like to be ported? I can start from there...

@jpcofr If you want you can start with [`HttpAnalyzer`](https://github.com/seladb/PcapPlusPlus/tree/master/Examples/HttpAnalyzer). It's a quite simple utility (or an example of how to use PcapPlusPlus), and it uses a `std::map` that can be converted to `std::unordered_map`. It also has quite a few for loops that can be modified, and I'm sure we can use the `auto` keyword more.
This utility has [python-based tests](https://github.com/seladb/PcapPlusPlus/blob/master/Tests/ExamplesTest/tests/test_httpanalyzer.py) that you can run locally, and they also run in GitHub Actions as part of the CI: https://github.com/seladb/PcapPlusPlus/actions/runs/5988356929/job/16243457492#step:8:65

Please let me know if you need any help
btw, maybe we can change the issue to C++20 directly.

> btw, maybe we can change the issue to C++20 directly.

@tigercosmos for now I prefer to keep supporting C++11 to support a broader variety of platforms and devices
Another thing is replacing `ostringstream` usages with `to_string` where it is used to convert only a single value to string.
Hi @seladb , I would also like to collaborate on this, is it still open?

> Hi @seladb , I would also like to collaborate on this, is it still open?

Yes sure, you're more than welcome to contribute! 🙏
Feel free to open PRs and we'll review

> > Hi @seladb , I would also like to collaborate on this, is it still open?
> 
> Yes sure, you're more than welcome to contribute! 🙏 Feel free to open PRs and we'll review

Great! I'm still looking through the repo but is there anywhere I should start for what should be ported next?

> > > Hi @seladb , I would also like to collaborate on this, is it still open?
> > 
> > 
> > Yes sure, you're more than welcome to contribute! 🙏 Feel free to open PRs and we'll review
> 
> Great! I'm still looking through the repo but is there anywhere I should start for what should be ported next?

No, you can start at any place that uses C++98  instead of C++11. You can also refer to some merged PR for references.

Hi @rtmeng ! I just replied to your email. If you're interested in something nice and simple to get into the project, you can try modernizing the [tutorials](https://github.com/seladb/PcapPlusPlus/tree/master/Examples/Tutorials) code
@Dimi1010 What are your thoughts on how much we still have to finish?

> @Dimi1010 What are your thoughts on how much we still have to finish?

@tigercosmos 

I think the `map` -> `unordered_map` is almost done. The only place I can find a `#include <map>` is in `TcpReassembly.h` and `TextBasedProtocol.h`, tho I haven't checked if that is deliberate.

For C-casts, I clean them up as I find them, but there are still plenty to go around... and it sucks you can't find them easily with a find command...

Two things I might add to the list:
- Increased preference on using `unique_ptr` and `shared_ptr` over the raw pointers for dynamic memory management.
- Increased preference of "pass-by-value + `std::move`" instead of `const T&` for constructor parameters that are just copied into member fields, as that would allow moving the parameter into the member field via double move than copying even when its not strictly required. Reasoning: https://stackoverflow.com/a/51706522/11922936
- - Setup of perfect forwarding is also an option, but its more of a hassle and requires templates.

@Dimi1010 For c style casts you can use `cppcheck`. It should point most of them. Just remove `cstyleCast:*` line from `cppcheckSuppressions.txt` and run pre-commit locally or directly cppcheck. It is up to you which one you run

Hi, i am trying to familiarise myself with the code base so i can later contribute with some tasks. This looks like a good way to start so i'd be happy to port some code to C++11 if that's OK ? I'll look at files in Packet++ first. if there's anything specific that should be done first please let me know.

-#endif
```

issueDTO.title: [docs-bug]: Navigation buttons out of logical order on documentation pages
issueDTO.description:
### Problem: What is happening?

Currently, the navigation buttons on some documentation pages do not follow a logical sequence.
For example, at the end of the “Add a project” page, the navigation buttons displayed in the footer do not follow the expected natural reading flow within the section.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a2334820-7d4f-423d-ac87-02635813a0ea)

### Expected behavior

Navigation buttons should follow a logical reading order.
In the example mentioned:

The “Previous” button should lead to the page “Remove Step from Pipeline”

The “Next” button should lead to the page “List Projects”

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07bbf26f-5cdc-493b-80c8-a65b03114dd1)


The same issue occurs on the “List Projects” page, where the recommended setup would be to organize the navigation buttons as follows, respecting a logical reading sequence:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8540b274-432f-4b9d-9965-fb8736db2112)



In the "environments" section, it might be helpful to add a reference link to the “How to add a project” page, allowing the user to revisit that instruction if needed.
This way, the navigation buttons can maintain a linear flow without compromising understanding.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/65305bc6-4695-41c2-b846-69d3beca2c3c)

### Steps to reproduce

1 - Access the documentation at: [devopness.com/docs](https://devopness.com/docs/)

2 - Navigate to the following sections:

   projects/add-project

   environments/add-environment

3 - Ensure that the "Previous" and "Next" navigation buttons follow the logical reading order.

4 - Also check other sections of the documentation for similar occurrences.



📌 Suggestion summary:
Fix the links for the navigation buttons so they follow the logical reading order of each section.
It is recommended to review all documentation sections to ensure consistency and good usability.


### Which Devopness module(s) are the source of the bug?

Documentation

### Package Version

_No response_

### Reproduction link

_No response_

### Additional details

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Materials in 3D projection mode have dimensions reset to (0.1, 0.1, 0.1) on server restart
issueDTO.description: Considering changing the material mode locks/unlocks the dimensions, this is probably a race condition. Maybe it'd be best to just leave the dimensions always unlocked?
comments:
I think we’re just missing a call to setUnscaledDimensions(_desiredDimensions) in MaterialEntityItem::setMaterialMappingMode if the new mode is not uv

this means not marking it as a renderProp in EntityItemProperties.txt and adding get/setMaterialMappingMode manually to the .h + .cpp files, where they need to do this: https://github.com/overte-org/overte/blob/f58f2705ead070410e95519a59f2c818cd82ac4b/libraries/entities/src/EntityItemPropertiesMacros.h#L637

plus the call to setUnscaledDimensions
Solving this would probably also fix #1339

summary.main: Materials in 3D projection mode have dimensions reset to (0.1, 0.1, 0.1) on server restart, which is likely a race condition. It's suggested to leave the dimensions always unlocked.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for materials in 3D projection mode to retain their dimensions after server restart without resetting to (0.1, 0.1, 0.1).
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding a call to setUnscaledDimensions(_desiredDimensions) in MaterialEntityItem::setMaterialMappingMode if the new mode is not uv. This involves not marking it as a renderProp in EntityItemProperties.txt and adding get/setMaterialMappingMode manually to the .h + .cpp files, where they need to do this: https://github.com/overte-org/overte/blob/f58f2705ead070410e95519a59f2c818cd82ac4b/libraries/entities/src/EntityItemPropertiesMacros.h#L637. Additionally, solving this issue would also fix #1339.

issueDTO.title: Feature: Add automatic language detection for text extraction
issueDTO.description:
**Description:**
Add automatic language detection capabilities to Kreuzberg to intelligently select appropriate OCR languages and processing options based on document content.

**Requirements:**
1. Implement language detection using an existing library (e.g., `langdetect`, `lingua-py`, or `fasttext`)
2. Add language detection as an optional feature that can be enabled in `ExtractionConfig`
3. When enabled, automatically detect language and configure OCR backend accordingly
4. Support detection from both extracted text and pre-OCR image analysis
5. Add caching for language detection results to avoid redundant processing

**Implementation Details:**
- Add new optional dependency group `[language-detection]` in `pyproject.toml`:
  ```toml
  optional-dependencies.language-detection = [
    "fast-langdetect>=0.2.0",  # 80x faster than langdetect, 95% accuracy
  ]
  ```
- **Library Choice Rationale**: Use `fast-langdetect` based on 2024 benchmarks showing it's 80x faster than alternatives while maintaining 95% accuracy
- Add `auto_detect_language: bool = False` to `ExtractionConfig`
- Add `detected_languages: list[str] | None` to `ExtractionResult`
- Create new module `kreuzberg/_language_detection.py` with detection logic
- Update OCR backends to use detected language when available
- Handle `MissingDependencyError` when language detection is enabled but library not installed

**Testing Requirements:**
- Test language detection with documents in multiple languages
- Test fallback behavior when detection fails
- Test integration with each OCR backend
- Test caching behavior
- Mock the language detection library in unit tests
- Add test files in different languages to `test_source_files/`

**Example Usage:**
```python
config = ExtractionConfig(auto_detect_language=True)
result = await extract_file("document.pdf", config=config)
print(f"Detected languages: {result.detected_languages}")
```
comments: I’d love to work on this; language detection is a lightweight but powerful enhancement that fits well with my experience designing adaptive pipelines. I’d use fast-langdetect for its speed and accuracy, wrap the logic in a dedicated module with caching, expose results via ExtractionResult, and hook into OCR to dynamically set the language. It’s a clean, modular feature, and I’m confident I can implement and test it efficiently.
go ahead

issueDTO.title: Resume Template Accessible Without Login (Authentication Issue)
issueDTO.description:
@MrYashSinghal  
Please assign this issue to me. I am contributing via **SSOC** and would love to work on it. 🙌

---

## 🐞 Bug Description
When I click on any resume template on the homepage, it directly opens the resume  **even if the user is not logged in**.

---

## 🚨 Expected Behavior
The `resume.html` page should be **protected**. Users who are not logged in should be **redirected to the login page (`Auth.html`)** instead of accessing the resume builder directly.

---

## ✅ Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the website without logging in.
2. Scroll down to the resume templates section.
3. Click any "Select" button.
4. You're redirected to `resume.html` even without authentication.

---

## 💡 Suggested Fix
Add a simple login check at the top of `resume.html` using localStorage:

```js
if (!localStorage.getItem("user")) {
  window.location.href = "Auth.html";
}

This allows admins or advanced users to generate multiple variations of a puzzle without affecting the original. Each fork maintains its version lineage for easy traceability and rollback. This module is **standalone** and should not depend on any other module.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Create a `ForkedPuzzle` entity to represent forked versions of puzzles.
* [ ] Implement version tracking logic to maintain relationships between original and forked puzzles.
* [ ] Add forking logic inside the admin interface/module that allows admins to:

> 💡 **Note:** Ensure the module is fully modular and plug-and-play, with reusable services and no reliance on external puzzle modules.

issueDTO.title: Track and Display User Puzzle Milestones
issueDTO.description:
This UserMilestoneModule tracks specific user achievements—such as completing 10 puzzles, 25 puzzles, etc.—as milestones. It operates independently from other modules and provides an endpoint to retrieve a user's milestone history. This can be used to celebrate progress and reward consistent engagement.

**Tasks:**

* Create a `Milestone` entity with fields like `id`, `title`, `description`, `requiredPuzzleCount`, and `achievedAt`.
* Implement an auto-assignment service that monitors completed puzzles and assigns milestones accordingly (e.g., after completing 10 puzzles).
* Build a REST endpoint:
  `GET /users/:id/milestones` — Returns a list of milestones the user has achieved.

**Note:**

* This module should not rely on any other module's logic.
* The milestone system should be extensible to accommodate future achievements.

issueDTO.title: Track Issued JWT Tokens Per User
issueDTO.description:
This UserTokenHistoryModule provides functionality for tracking all JWT tokens issued to users. It enables the platform to record when tokens were issued, their expiration, and supports revocation of all tokens for a given user — useful for logout-all-sessions or security enforcement. The module should be self-contained and not depend on any other module in the codebase.

**Tasks:**

* [ ] Create `TokenHistory` entity with fields for user ID, token metadata, and revocation status
* [ ] Store metadata like `issuedAt`, `expiresAt`, and possibly IP/device info (optional)
* [ ] Implement a service method to revoke all tokens for a user (e.g., after password reset)
* [ ] Add repository methods to retrieve and filter token history per user

issueDTO.title: Audio/Video understanding
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
```
> transcribe @VO.mp3

✦ I am sorry, but I cannot understand the content of the audio file you sent. If you can provide a
  transcript or a summary of the audio, I would be happy to help you with it.
```

**Client information**
```
╭────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╮
│                                                                    │
│ About Gemini CLI                                                   │
│                                                                    │
│ CLI Version            0.1.1                                       │
│ Git Commit             852210e1 (local modifications)              │
│ Model                  gemini-2.5-pro                              │
│ Sandbox                no sandbox                                  │
│ OS                     darwin                                      │
│                                                                    │
╰────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╯
```

**Additional context**
The README mentions Gemini's multimodal capabilities. When using Gemini API, it supports audio/video input, but when using Gemini CLI, it refuses. I asked Gemini to diagnose itself, here's what it has to say:

> ✦ From my perspective as the model operating within the Gemini CLI, my core intelligence is indeed multi-modal and capable of processing various data types, including audio.
>
> However, I am dependent on the tools provided to me within this specific command-line environment to interact with your local files. The tool I use for accessing file content, `read_file`, does not currently support processing audio formats like .mp3.
>
> When you referenced `@VO.mp3`, the `read_file` tool attempted to access it and returned the message: "Cannot display content of binary file". I received only that error message, not the audio data itself. Therefore, the limitation is not in my analytical capability but in the data ingestion mechanism of the tools available in my current environment.
comments: Right now, read_file supports text, images (PNG, JPG, GIF, WEBP, SVG, BMP), and PDF files.

hi, I'm curious about the future plans for Gemini CLI, particularly around expanding its multimodal capabilities. Is the plan to increase support for additional filetypes incrementally, adding them by PRs one by one?

I’d love to contribute to the project, maybe by helping implement support for a new filetype or a similar feature @allenhutchison

Gemini CLI can handle audio if the video lives on Youtube for example. Here's my coworker Smitha showing an example https://www.linkedin.com/posts/smithakolan_i-just-used-the-new-gemini-cli-to-set-up-activity-7343679677594484736-LbJb?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAABfA4eIBuSqMEo5g7a3wzq_QqP_7fOeAnHA

@fhinkel i think that is a great workaround. but correct me if im wrong, the video is just gemini doing 2 web fetches:

1. to go to the youtube video and read the description which contains the linked github repo
2. to go to the found github repo and scan the directory

but there's no audio processing it seems
@Gable-github is correct, that example does not actually use youtube, and only works if the content is available elsewhere on the internet. This FR is for integrated support.

This might be a good first issue. when I added this functionality I fairly arbitrarily restricted the formats to image and pdf. You should likely be able to extend this by adding support to the detectFileType method in fileUtils.ts and then the appropriate support in read-file.ts and then update the uses of detectFileType to handle video and audio file types. In particular look at processSingleFileContent in fileUtils.ts and update that appropriately for your file types likely just matching what happens for 'image' and 'pdf'
I would like to work on this issue. could someone with permissions please assign it to me, or should I go ahead and start a draft PR (seems to be the case for the other issues)? thanks!

Hey Gabe:)
I was actually hoping to work on this issue too. Totally happy to collaborate if you're open to that, or if you’ve already started something, I’d love to follow along and help however I can. Let me know what works best!

issueDTO.title: Feature Request: Shortcut for “Show bookmarks only on new tab page
issueDTO.description:
#### Summary

Currently, in Brave’s keyboard shortcuts, you can only enable or disable the bookmarks bar globally. 
However, there is a third option, available via the bookmarks bar context menu or appearance menu: to show bookmarks only on the new tab page.

It would be very useful to have a keyboard shortcut to toggle this specific mode (“Show bookmarks only on new tab page”), as is already possible for the other two options (always on / always off).

#### Reason

This would allow users to quickly switch between all three bookmarks bar visibility states using the keyboard without having to navigate to the brave://settings/appearance page.
- It would provide feature parity between the menu options and the available shortcuts.
- Power users and those who rely heavily on keyboard navigation would strongly benefit from this addition.
- It's an implementation that includes all possible options, at a design level, it's a clear improvement.

#### Who and Where

I tested the shortcut already present in my up-to-date Brave browser:
[Brave 1.79.126 (Official Build) (64-bit)](https://brave.com/latest/) Chromium: 137.0.7151.119

I did some research to verify if the shortcut exists, and now I'm here to open this improvement.

Thank you for watching this request!
Best regards, Luca

Ok this my first time doing open source. Will try to implement the feature as requested.

issueDTO.title: <shift>-<enter> should do an enter but keep user control
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes I want to tell gemini cli: 
"""
Look at this output, this is clearly wrong:

  - gic_migration_2024_06_25: ✅ Assertion passed: Command succeeded.
  - sakura_repo_exists: ✅ Path exists: /Users/ricc/git/sakura
"""

Where the first part (lines 1/2) im typing and the second part (3/4) is the output of some commands i cut pasted.

However, as soon as I press the first eNTER i lose control and gemini cli gets it. We need to have some mechanism to introduce an <ENTER> without ceding focus to the LLM and still be in tyiuping mode.

I suppose SHIFT ENTER is the most natural, but happy to consider others too (or maybe one exists and Im not aware of it)
comments:
I'd support this, and it would be a good first issue for someone interested in contributing.

If no one takes it though then I will.

Heads up, we do support shift-enter on mac if you follow the same steps that Claude asks you to follow to configure your terminal to support it. https://b.corp.google.com/issues/424007249 has more details.
Related: #1699
,take

Just to add, I personally use the Warp Terminal on Mac. By default, Warp allows you to add a new-line using either of the following:

* ⇧ + ↵ Enter
* ⌥ + ↵ Enter

But once you are running Gemini, it doesn't work with either approach.
Thamks for the info on warp. We would really appreciate a pull request to make both of them work  when Gemini Cli is running in warp.

hey @maisyk as per my knowledge warp isnt a terminal on its own, it uses a custom Rust-based UI framework and handles input at the application layer, not via the OS TTY driver

Warp collects keystrokes in its own internal editor, only sending the buffer to the shell on Enter or whatever you configure

so when we use gemini on warp, it is no different than using a gemini on a normal terminal, i hope this helps us understand this issue better

The issue description includes a step-by-step summary of the debugging process, which revealed that the default macOS Terminal strips the Shift modifier information from both the Enter key and the arrow keys, making a code-only fix unfeasible on this specific platform.

issueDTO.title: Bad error messages in ClassifierChain on multioutput multiclass
issueDTO.description:
trying to run classifier chain on a multiclass problem with a reshaped y (which is interpreted as multioutput multiclass) doesn't work (see #9245), which is fine. But the error messages are really bad making it hard to understand what's going on.

We should detect that we're trying to do multioutput multiclass instead of multilabel and give an informative error.
comments: Hey Im pretty new, can I take a look at this and try to fix it?

This should reproduce the issue:

```py
from sklearn.multioutput import ClassifierChain
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.datasets import make_classification

Xs, ys = zip(*(make_classification(random_state=i, n_classes=3, n_informative=3) for i in range(3)))
X = np.hstack(Xs)
Y = np.transpose(ys)
ClassifierChain(LogisticRegression()).fit(X, Y).predict(X)
```

but actually this is running without complaint for me!!

@amueller, please provide a reproducible snippet??

ah, it's only ``decision_function`` that's broken.
If ``predict`` works, maybe fixing ``decision_function`` is reasonable?
I didn't actually read #9245 in detail: it looks like the ``predict`` part is already done in master?


```python
from sklearn.multioutput import ClassifierChain
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.datasets import make_classification
import numpy as np

Xs, ys = zip(*(make_classification(random_state=i, n_classes=3, n_informative=3) for i in range(3)))
X = np.hstack(Xs)
Y = np.transpose(ys)
ClassifierChain(LogisticRegression()).fit(X, Y).decision_function(X)
```
Maybe we should try fixing decision_function and predict_proba and if that's too hard we should raise attribute errors in the multioutput multiclass case?

In case of  raising an attribute error, is it enough to add an if statement, that calls the type_of_target function of Y? Something along the line of:
` if type_of_target(Y_decision_chain) == 'multiclass-multioutput':
    raise AttributeError("decision_function currently does not support multiclass-multioutput as target type")`

It shouldn't be hard to impenetrable support I think. type_of_target will
be easiest to apply at fit time.

So what do we need to add for this support? As I understood decision_function expects a 2d-Array when calling estimator.decision_function(X_aug) but since in our case its a multiclass-multioutput target type it gets a list of 2d-arrays instead.
Is it suitable to just add more collumns to the variable Y_decision_chain and fill it with the collumns from each 2d-array from the list of 2d-arrays we get?

Something like that. You might need to use the classes_ attribute of the
underlying estimators to get the columns lined up when cv might result in a
class being missing from one training set or another.

So I looked at it again and made some modifications but Im really not sure if I understood it correctly.
This is the code that I changed in the decision_function.
```
decision_function_result =  estimator.decision_function(X_aug)
if decision_function_result.shape[1] == 1:
    Y_decision_chain[:, chain_idx] = decision_function_result
else:
    Y_decision_chain[:, chain_idx] = decision_function_result[:,chain_idx]
```

Basicly each multi-output classifier in the Classifierchain is responsible for one row in the Y_decision_chain matrix. I threw away my previous idea of adding rows to Y_decision_chain , since it still need to conform the output rule of the decision_function.
Is this solving the problem at hand?
I'm sorry if it might be wrong or if I didn't understand you correctly.
I dont know how else to use the decision_function of each estimator to modify the Y_decision_chain, since each class is being predicted multible times.
Hi, I'm new and looking for an issue to work on. Is this issue still open?
@michellemroy there's currently some work being done in #14654
I am new to the repo , is this issue still open?
Hi, can I work on this? I'm new so can someone guide me?
Hello, Can I use this issue as my first contribution? I'm new so please can someone guide me?
I would like to contribute but we should assign the tickets that are open but appear to be assigned.
If this issue hasn't been resolved already, iId like to contribute! It would be my first open-source contribution
Hi everyone, I'm new to the open source world and I want to contribute, please let me know a easy good first issue to start with. It will be really helpful if someone can guide me.
I am working on this!
Can anyone confirm is this issue still open or not??
As far as I can see, this is now closed - the code aboves still returns an error, but the error looks reasonably intelligible. I would close this issue unless others feel differently.
Hello, I'm new and was guided here as I was looking for an issue to fix, is this problem still open?

I still see it as Open on the github.
I'll anyways try to make a fix and practice if that's okay !
Hi! I’m a first-time contributor and would like to work on this issue. Could you please assign it to me?
Is this issue still open? I’d like to work on it if possible. Thanks!
A first step to working on this is to evaluate if the reproducer still reproduces the error, what the error is and if it is indeed hard to understand. This is because this issue is quite old.

issueDTO.title: `ValueError` raised by `FeatureUnion._set_output` with `FunctionTransform` that outputs a pandas `Series` in scikit-learn version 1.6
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

Hello,

I'm currently working with scikit-learn version 1.6, and I encountered a regression that wasn't present in version 1.4.

The following minimal code computes two features — the cumulative mean of age and weight grouped by id. Each transformation function returns a pandas.Series:



When I run this code with scikit-learn 1.6, I get the following error:

After investigation, I found that the issue occurs because each transformer returns a Series, not a DataFrame. If I update the functions to return DataFrame objects instead, the error disappears.

Interestingly, in scikit-learn 1.4, the same code works correctly even when the functions return Series.


Do you have any explanation for why this changed between version 1.4 and 1.6 ?

Thanks in advance for your help!

### Steps/Code to Reproduce


```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.pipeline import FunctionTransformer, FeatureUnion
import numpy as np

def compute_cumulative_mean_age(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.Series:
    return (
        df["age"]
        .astype(float)
        .groupby(df["id"])
        .expanding()
        .mean()
        .droplevel(level="id")
        .reindex(df.index)
        .rename("cumulative_mean_age")
    )

def compute_cumulative_mean_weight(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.Series:
    return (
        df["poids"]
        .astype(float)
        .groupby(df["id"])
        .expanding()
        .mean()
        .droplevel(level="id")
        .reindex(df.index)
        .rename("cumulative_mean_weight")
    )

def compute_features(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    feature_union = FeatureUnion(
        [
            ("cumulative_mean_age", FunctionTransformer(compute_cumulative_mean_age)),
            ("cumulative_mean_weight", FunctionTransformer(compute_cumulative_mean_weight))
        ]
    ).set_output(transform="pandas")

    return feature_union.fit_transform(X=df).astype(float)

def transform(df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
    return compute_features(df)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    np.random.seed(42)
    df = pd.DataFrame({
        'id': [1, 2, 3, 1, 4, 5, 6, 6, 7, 8],
        'age': np.random.randint(18, 70, size=10),
        'poids': np.random.randint(50, 100, size=10)
    })

    print(transform(df))
```

### Expected Results

```pytb
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\tmp.py", line 73, in <module>
    print(transform(df=df))
          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\tmp.py", line 55, in transform
    return compute_features(
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\tmp.py", line 45, in compute_features
    .fit_transform(
     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\_set_output.py", line 332, in wrapped
    return _wrap_data_with_container(method, data_to_wrap, X, self)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\_set_output.py", line 307, in _wrap_data_with_container
    return adapter.create_container(
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\_set_output.py", line 135, in create_container
    X_output = _create_pandas_dataframe_from_non_pandas_container(
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\sklearn\utils\fixes.py", line 428, in _create_pandas_dataframe_from_non_pandas_container
    return pd.DataFrame(X, index=index, copy=copy)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py", line 722, in __init__
    mgr = ndarray_to_mgr(
          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\construction.py", line 349, in ndarray_to_mgr
    _check_values_indices_shape_match(values, index, columns)
  File "C:\Users\XXX\PycharmProjects\fraude_detection_pec_audio\.venv\Lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\construction.py", line 420, in _check_values_indices_shape_match
    raise ValueError(f"Shape of passed values is {passed}, indices imply {implied}")
ValueError: Shape of passed values is (20, 1), indices imply (10, 1)
```

### Actual Results

```pytb
    raise ValueError(f"Shape of passed values is {passed}, indices imply {implied}")
ValueError: Shape of passed values is (20, 1), indices imply (10, 1)
```

### Versions

```shell
sklearn: 1.6.0
numpy: 1.26.4
pandas: 1.5.3
```
comments:
I would argue that the previous beahviour worked by chance but it was a bug. Scikit-learn transformers API expect to return an array of shape `(n_samples, n_features)`. Having a single dimension is really ambiguous because we cannot guess if it is a single sample or a single feature. For instance, if you use `set_output(transform="default")`, then you will get an array of shape `(20,)` where I would argue that the `FeatureUnion` failed.

So here, I think that the fact that we raise an error is actually fine. The error message is a bit tricky thought. The fact it does not raise with `set_output(transform="default")` is actually annoying I think.

So one way would be to validate the output of `FunctionTransformer` being sure it should be 2-D. However, we sometime want this transformer to be lenient so I wonder if the behaviour should be driven by a parameter, similarly to the `validate` parameter but for the output.

@jeremiedbb @ogrisel do you have any thoughts regarding if `FunctionTransformer` should be permissive regarding the shape of the output or if we should strictly follow the API of other transformers.

I'm thinking that we usually want this transformer to be permissive on the input side.

Note that the mentioned code already raises 2 informative warnings before raising the final exception:

```python
/Users/ogrisel/code/scikit-learn/sklearn/preprocessing/_function_transformer.py:311: UserWarning: When `set_output` is configured to be 'pandas', `func` should return a pandas DataFrame to follow the `set_output` API  or `feature_names_out` should be defined.
  warnings.warn(warn_msg.format("pandas"))
/Users/ogrisel/code/scikit-learn/sklearn/preprocessing/_function_transformer.py:311: UserWarning: When `set_output` is configured to be 'pandas', `func` should return a pandas DataFrame to follow the `set_output` API  or `feature_names_out` should be defined.
  warnings.warn(warn_msg.format("pandas"))
```

The function transformer should not return a pandas series but a pandas dataframe.

Maybe we could change this to accept series and automatically wrap them as dataframes because there is no ambiguity in this particular case.

If not, I agree that we should at least improve the error message.

Let me try to simplify the reproducer to make it minimal.

Here is a minimal reproducer:

```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.preprocessing import FunctionTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import FeatureUnion


data = pd.DataFrame(dict(a=range(3), b=range(3)))
FeatureUnion(
    [
        ("a", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["a"])),
        ("b", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["b"])),  # exception not raised if you remove this line.
    ]
).set_output(transform="pandas").fit_transform(data)
```

Note that the `FeatureUnion` requires 2 series, otherwise there are no exceptions, only the warnings.

Actually, here is the real bug in my opinion: if you remove the `.set_output("pandas")` from the above snippet, the code works without failing or raising warnings but outputs meaningless results:

```python
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.preprocessing import FunctionTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import FeatureUnion


data = pd.DataFrame(dict(a=range(3), b=range(3)))
FeatureUnion(
    [
        ("a", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["a"])),
        ("b", FunctionTransformer(lambda df: df["b"])),
    ]
).fit_transform(data)
```
```
array([0, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2])
```

Instead, `FeatureUnion` should raise an explicit error message to make it explicit that some transformers output 1d data-structures instead of the expected 2d.

I think the `FeatureUnion._hstack` method should be changed to raise an informative error message if some elements in `Xs` are not 2D data-structures. We should also check that their `.shape[0]` match the expected number of samples measured on the `X` parameter passed to `FeatureUnion.transform` or `FeatureUnion.fit_transform`.

EDIT: the error message of the exception should mention the name of the transformer that generated invalid output shapes along with the observed shape and the expected number of data points.

<!--
Carefully read and work through this check list in order to prevent the most common mistakes and misuse of youtube-dl:
- First of, make sure you are using the latest version of youtube-dl. Run `youtube-dl --version` and ensure your version is 2021.12.17. If it's not, see https://yt-dl.org/update on how to update. Issues with outdated version will be REJECTED.
- Search the bugtracker for similar site feature requests: http://yt-dl.org/search-issues. DO NOT post duplicates.
- Finally, put x into all relevant boxes (like this [x])
-->

- [x] I'm reporting a site feature request
- [x] I've verified that I'm running youtube-dl version **2021.12.17**
- [x] I've searched the bugtracker for similar site feature requests including closed ones


## Description

<!--
Provide an explanation of your site feature request in an arbitrary form. Please make sure the description is worded well enough to be understood, see https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl#is-the-description-of-the-issue-itself-sufficient. Provide any additional information, suggested solution and as much context and examples as possible.
-->

With the latest google search versions, one can look up "NFL" (for example), and the schedules, players and teams pop-up as well as (and this is what I'm suggesting to implement) previews or highlights. When trying to download them from the Google page, it does not recognizes it, the user needs to get into the actual video (youtube in most cases) to get it. Implementing this would mean much faster access to videos and the users not having to navigate several layers of webpages to download them.
I tried creating a general "google extractor" but couldn't manage to do it. Other option I thought about but could not put into practice was to handle that webpage forwarding (google search -> youtube) within the program
comments:
You'll need to open the search page with JS disabled to see anything like what yt-dl would see. With any luck, the video page will be the value of a parameter, eg `q`, in the link in the search page.

Some examples of search pages, video links in the pages and the linked videos could help this along.
There is already a google search extractor. It is broken atm, but easy to fix. See https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/commit/c533c89ce1d6965d8575413738d76a5bf9e2de59

Thanks.

First see https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/29724 and the issue linked from it, and the manual, especially the section linked from there.

From the [comment](https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/30576#issuecomment-1026427016), possibly the linked fork has fixed the extractor and you will just need to back-port the change.

Once you have a branch working in your fork, you can make a Pull Request against the yt-dl repo.
how do i back-port the change ? I just search what it mean, should it mean that i should Copy paste the commit and make the PR myself ?
i make a fork myself so I doing to work like that (use the commit of @pukkandan )

One way is to use a tool like [_meld_](https://opensource.com/article/20/3/meld), a graphical difference editor. Check out yt-dl and yt-dlp, load the yt-dlp extractor into the editor and load the yt-dl extractor into the right-hand pane. Then you can go through the differences and decide whether the yt-dlp change should applied directly, modified or ignored. Some changes will be specific to yt-dlp and need to be adapted so as to run on both Python 2 and 3. For example, the linked commit includes these lines that will fail in Python 2 
```
                'http://www.google.com/search', f'gvsearch:{query}',
                note=f'Downloading result page {pagenum + 1}',
```
You'll need to change this in some way, say:
```
                'http://www.google.com/search', 'gvsearch:' + query,
                note='Downloading result page %d' % (pagenum + 1, ),
```

Some IDE plug-in or judicious use of _vi_ and _diff_ could achieve the same result.

If there is a specific change, a commit or set of commits, that should be applied, you can use _git_ magic to apply such commits while preserving the commit details. In GH you can add `.patch` to commit and PR URLs to generate a patch file that you can pass to the `git am` command: to make the patch applicable you first have to edit it to replace the `yt_dlp/` in pathnames with `youtube_dl/`. After applying the patch to your branch you can make any additional changes in your own subsequent commit. Eventually when this gets merged we would probably `squash` the commits in the PR so that the resulting commit appears as `Co-authored by:` all the people whose commits are included.

As above, test the modified extractor in your patch branch (there's a small test in the linked commit). Then push the branch to your yt-dl fork. You should be able to enable the server-side tests that ensure your changes work in a variety of supported environments. Fix any issues and then create a PR against our youtube_dl repo.

Please do.
Can I work on this issue if no one's on it? @dirkf

issueDTO.title: 【0.3.0发布TODO区】在这里查看0.3.0更新待完成内容
issueDTO.description:
# Abstract
本issue着重讨论下个版本0.3.0的主要更新内容，并讨论实现路线最终尽力在两个星期之内完工所有任务

# Introduction
考虑到0.2.0是测试版本，有大量bug和不兼容问题，在0.3.0都将得以解决。现在，本项目将进一步发展单人对话模式和沉浸感。通过自动纠错AI对话，赋予时间感知和视觉感知，搭配存档系统或者RAG系统，提供长期，稳定，真实的体验。现在，会在下面提出所有下个版本将会更新的内容，当所有进度完成后，即将打包发布新的release并且发布视频。

# Chapter 1 沉浸对话体验
## 功能总览：
- 自定义+多人物对话系统【√】
- 存档功能+本地RAG系统【√】
- 自定义上传背景功能【√】
- 自定义音乐背景音功能【√】
- 在没有vits的情况下使用对话音效【√】
- 新增对Style-Bert-Vits2的支持【√】
- 12->18种情绪识别，AI模型升级【√】
- 视觉+时间感知功能【√】   

## 功能介绍：
1. 现在可以自定义自己的角色，导入任何素材，为ai和自己起名字，定义信息，定义vits模型，并在角色列表选择喜欢的角色对话！
2. 可以把与角色的对话记忆存入存档中或者RAG系统中，实现记忆永存，暂存，不再让对话在每次程序关闭时候消失！
3. 可以自定义背景，给玩家更多的沉浸式体验
4. 可以自定义背景音乐，可以是白噪声或者BGM，符合真实的galgame
5. 让AI可以看到用户的桌面信息，感知到和用户同步的时间，让用户的对话更加真实
6. 当没有vits的时候，允许用户执行无日文语音模式，将对话生成速度提升两倍以上，便于学习模式
7. 新增Bert模型，可以用更少的数据量获取vits语音，并且效果更加可靠音质更好
8. 更多的情绪模型识别，给予更好的emo陪伴，还有发情陪伴

# Chapter 2 UI升级
## 功能总览：
- 新增桌宠，可以截图提问问题【】
- 新增exe打包的网页，打包缓存免得强奸用户C盘【√】
- 新增设定网页，方便用户更便利的设定自己的信息【√】
- 新增加载动画【√】

## 功能介绍：
1. 桌宠模式为测试模式，使用PYQT开发，可以通过截图功能获取一部分桌面信息，实现“小灵搜题”的效果
2. 网页被打包后，更方便启动，更美观
3. 在settings.html种，可以更轻松的设定API的信息和各种文件保存配置
4. 给了网页一个可爱的加载动画，用于等待本地浏览器加载数据

# Chapter 3 Bug修复
## 功能总览：
- 取消浏览器缓存机制，修复语音，角色图片等因为缓存的问题【√】
- 为等待语音生成宽容更多的时间，防止CPU运行过慢导致语音失败【√】

# Chapter 4 扩展支持 
## 功能总览：
- 支持用户自定义角色，开放创意工坊【√】
- 允许本地大模型的接入，允许视觉模型，文本模型分离自定义等【√】

# Chapter 5 代码更新 - 开发者部分
## 更新总览：
- 重构了前后端，符合设计规范【√】
- 钦灵和风雪删除了代码中的娇喘，保持间接性【√】
- 提供了给开发者的doc文档供参考【√】
- 修复了冗余的log部分【√】

## 开发者须知：
有需要补充的更新，还有完成的更新，在本issue下方通知～(∠・ω< )⌒★

issueDTO.title: Timed Puzzle Challenge Mode
issueDTO.description:
Introduce a standalone TimeTrialModule that enables a special game mode where users participate in time-limited puzzle challenges. The goal is to enhance engagement and reward speed and accuracy. Users will compete to solve puzzles before time runs out, earning exclusive in-game rewards. This module also optionally integrates with the global leaderboard system but should function independently.

---

### ✅ Tasks

* **Create `TimeTrial` entity**

  * Fields: `id`, `startTime`, `endTime`, `puzzleId`, `userId`
  * Ensure proper relations and indexing for performance
* **Implement time tracking logic**

  * Track when a user starts and ends a trial
  * Automatically validate completion against time limits
* **Build endpoints**

  * Start time trial
  * Submit puzzle attempt
  * Retrieve time trial results
* **(Optional) Leaderboard integration**

  * Rank users by completion time
  * Display top performers for specific puzzles
comments:

issueDTO.title: A NumberFormatException occurs when using IPv6 and reconnecting. / 使用IPv6断开连接或触发"重新连接服务器"功能时出现NumberFormatException
issueDTO.description:
### Environment _环境_
- GeyserExtras version: 2.0.0-BETA-6(Platform Type: Standalone)
- Geyser version: Geyser version 2.8.0-b865 (git-master-7bb777e) (Java: 1.21.6, Bedrock: 1.21.70 - 1.21.73 - 1.21.90)
- Server type: STANDALONE
- Java version: openjdk 21.0.5 2024-10-15
OpenJDK Runtime Environment OpenLogic-OpenJDK (build 21.0.5+11-adhoc.root.jdk21u)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM OpenLogic-OpenJDK (build 21.0.5+11-adhoc.root.jdk21u, mixed mode)
- Network environment: IPv6 connection(IPv6 starting with a few bits: `240e:f7:a020:203......`)

### Bug Description 问题描述
_当玩家通过 IPv6 连接断开服务器并触发“重新连接服务器”功能时，在处理 `SessionDisconnectEvent` 期间发生 `NumberFormatException`。错误发生在 `ExtrasPlayer.java:170` 尝试将字符串 `"f7"` 解析为整数时。_
When a player disconnects from the server using IPv6 and triggers the "Reconnect Server" feature, a `NumberFormatException` occurs during `SessionDisconnectEvent` handling. The error happens when trying to parse string `"f7"` as an integer at `ExtrasPlayer.java:170`.

### Steps to Reproduce _重现步骤_
1. Connect to server via _IPv6 通过 IPv6 连接到服务器_
2. Use "Reconnect Server" feature or disconnect normally _使用“重新连接服务器”功能或正常断开连接_
3. Exception occurs in console _控制台出现异常_

  * Fetching quizzes
  * Submitting answers
  * Getting results

issueDTO.title: Time-Gated Hint System for Puzzles
issueDTO.description:
Implement a self-contained `HintModule` that manages time-locked hints for puzzles. This module should not depend on any other system or module (such as the puzzle module itself), ensuring it can be independently tested and reused.

---

### ✅ Tasks:

* Create a `Hint` entity with fields such as:

  * `id`: number
  * `puzzleId`: string (to associate the hint with a puzzle ID)
  * `content`: string
  * `unlockTimeInMinutes`: number (delay after puzzle start)
* Create a service to:

  * Retrieve hints based on puzzle ID and elapsed time
  * Filter out hints that haven’t reached their unlock time
* Create a controller with an endpoint:

  * `GET /hints/:puzzleId` – Returns all hints available at the time of request for a given puzzle
* Add basic auth middleware or user context simulation (if needed) to simulate tracking of time since puzzle start

---

### 🎯 Acceptance Criteria:

* [ ] Hints are stored and retrieved independently of any puzzle or user logic
* [ ] Each hint becomes visible only after its `unlockTimeInMinutes` has passed since puzzle start time (simulated for now)
* [ ] `GET /hints/:puzzleId` returns only the hints that should be visible based on the time
* [ ] Module is 100% standalone – no imports or dependencies from any puzzle, game, or user modules

issueDTO.title: Handle the Schedule of the Puzzles
issueDTO.description:
This standalone PuzzleScheduleModule manages the unlocking of specific puzzles on scheduled days. It includes a scheduler service that checks the current date and time, then unlocks the appropriate puzzle. Each unlock event is also logged for tracking and auditing purposes.

**Tasks:**

* Create a `PuzzleScheduleModule` with all necessary imports and configuration
* Implement a **Daily Unlock Scheduler** to run once per day (e.g., via cron or timeout)
* Build a **SchedulerService** to handle logic for:

  * Checking today's date
  * Determining which puzzle to unlock
  * Marking puzzles as unlocked
* Implement **Unlock Logs** to record each time a puzzle is unlocked

**Notes:**
This module must be completely self-contained and should not depend on other parts of the application. Consider using in-memory or mock data structures if persistence is not part of this module’s scope.

issueDTO.title: In-App Notifications for Rewards, Puzzles & Announcements
issueDTO.description:
Create a standalone In-App module responsible for delivering in-app notifications to users. These notifications will inform users about new rewards, puzzles, and general announcements. The module must function independently and not depend on any other part of the codebase.

---

**Tasks:**

* Create `Notification` entity with fields such as:

  * `id`
  * `title`
  * `message`
  * `type` (enum: 'reward', 'puzzle', 'announcement')
  * `isRead`
  * `recipientUserId`
  * `createdAt`

* Implement a `BroadcasterService` to send notifications to:

  * All users (for announcements)
  * Specific users (for puzzle/reward notifications)

* Add ability to mark notifications as read

* Expose controller endpoints to:

  * Get all notifications for a user
  * Mark notification as read
  * Broadcast a new notification
comments:
Hi, I'm a Backend Developer with experience in building modular and scalable systems. I’d love to work on creating the standalone In-App Notification module.

To start, I’ll design the `Notification` entity to include fields like `id`, `title`, `message`, `type` (reward, puzzle, or announcement), `isRead`, `recipientUserId`, and `createdAt`. These fields will form the foundation of the system, ensuring a clear structure for storing and retrieving notifications.

Next, I'll implement a `BroadcasterService` to handle sending notifications efficiently. This service will broadcast announcements to all users and deliver targeted notifications for rewards or puzzles to specific users. I'll ensure this service is independent and designed for easy scaling.

For user interactions, I'll expose controller endpoints to fetch all notifications for a user, mark notifications as read, and broadcast new notifications. These endpoints will prioritize responsiveness and usability, allowing users to interact seamlessly with their notifications.

Finally, I'll ensure thorough testing, writing unit tests for the service and entity logic, and integration tests for the API endpoints. This will guarantee the module is robust and performs as expected.

I’m excited to contribute to this project and help enhance the user experience with a reliable and flexible notification system!

issueDTO.title: Save and Manage Puzzle Drafts
issueDTO.description:
Create a standalone PuzzleDraftModule that allows puzzle creators (admins or contributors) to save puzzles as drafts before publishing them live. This ensures puzzle ideas can be iteratively built and reviewed without being immediately visible to users.

---

#### ✅ Tasks

* **Create `DraftPuzzle` Entity**

  * Fields: `id`, `title`, `description`, `content`, `createdBy`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`, etc.
  * Must not depend on the final `Puzzle` entity or module.

* **Implement Draft Creation Endpoint**

  * `POST /drafts`
  * Accepts puzzle content and metadata from authenticated admins/contributors.
  * Saves to the `DraftPuzzle` entity.

* **Implement Get All Drafts Endpoint**

  * `GET /drafts`
  * Admin-only route to retrieve all existing drafts.

* **Implement Update Draft Endpoint**

  * `PATCH /drafts/:id`
  * Allows editing of an existing draft.

* **Implement Delete Draft Endpoint**

  * `DELETE /drafts/:id`
  * Permanently deletes a puzzle draft.

* **Implement Publish Draft Endpoint**

  * `POST /drafts/:id/publish`
  * Converts a draft to a final published puzzle (this should trigger an event or return the structured data, but the actual publishing logic will be handled by the publishing module—not part of this module).

---

**Note:**
This module must be completely **self-contained** and **not depend on other modules** like `PuzzleModule`. It should expose data via DTOs and events if integration is needed later.

issueDTO.title: User Puzzle Reporting System

  * `PATCH /reports/:id`: Allow admins to mark reports as resolved or update content

  * Only authenticated users can create reports
  * Only admin users can view or resolve reports

* **Basic Moderation Logic**

  * Auto-tag reports as 'unresolved' by default

issueDTO.title: User Activity Tracker System
issueDTO.description:
Create a standalone AuditLogModule to track and log major user activities across the platform (e.g., submissions, claims, login, updates). This helps administrators monitor actions and detect potential misuse or unusual behavior. The module must be completely self-contained and should not depend on any other module in the system.

---

**Tasks:**

* Define `AuditLog` entity with fields like:

  * `id`
  * `userId`
  * `action`
  * `timestamp`
  * `meta` (optional JSON or text for extra details)
* Create an **interceptor** or **middleware** to automatically capture and log user actions.
* Implement an **Admin API** endpoint to:

  * Fetch all logs
  * Filter logs by `userId`, `action`, or `date`
* Add Swagger documentation (or similar) for the Admin API.

issueDTO.title: Wallet Module — Link, Verify, and Store StarkNet Wallets
issueDTO.description:
This WalletModule handles everything related to StarkNet wallet management. It allows users to link their wallets, verifies wallet signatures (mocked/stubbed for now), and persists wallet data. The module is designed to be completely standalone, without any dependency on other parts of the system.

---

#### ✅ Tasks:

* Create `Wallet` entity with fields like `id`, `address`, `createdAt`, `updatedAt`
* Implement service to handle linking logic
* Add mock/stub function to verify wallet signature
* Build controller to expose APIs for:

  * Link wallet (POST)
  * Verify signature (POST or GET)
* Ensure module is fully independent with its own:

  * `WalletModule`
  * `WalletService`
  * `WalletController`
  * `WalletEntity`

issueDTO.title: Command-line option to execute last ran kando item
issueDTO.description:
### Description

This data will only be stored for running session of kando.

Usecase- bind keyboad to this action so that all action that can be executed multiple times dosen't have to open kando menu multiple times  (i.e, next song, next wallpaper, next workspace).

### Affected Desktop Environments

All

### Additional Information

In 2.0 we will have deeplink, if deeplink is faster than command-line execution that it should be preffered for implemention this feature as it remove any preceived latency, otherwise if both speed same please choose the implementaion on convenience.

issueDTO.title: 2025 Spring AI Alibaba 技术博客/视频征集
issueDTO.description:
### Description

如果您在调研或者使用Spring AI Alibaba和Jmanus，欢迎<font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">大家用自己擅长的方式创作Spring AI Alibaba/Jmanus相关作品，并通过技术博客或者短视频分享Spring AI Alibaba/Jmanus的介绍、技术解析、最佳实践、使用案例。</font>

## 参与方式:
1.撰写技术博客或者制作视频，发布至个人博客、CSDN等开发者社区、B站、视频号等视频平台。
2.将文章/视频地址发布至此 issue 评论区。
3.投稿后通过这个地址[提交个人收件信息](https://survey.aliyun.com/apps/zhiliao/aX4Z_BS8a)



## 奖品说明
1. 社区参与奖（数量不限）：只要投稿的作者就可以获得阿里巴巴开源纪念品，咖啡杯、T恤二选一
2. 优秀贡献奖（2名）：每月最后一个工作日，评委会根据投稿内容的技术先进性、内容可读性、文章/视频阅读量三个维度进行打分，评选出2位优秀贡献奖，奖品是无线手机充电支架。



## <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">投稿作品要求</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">作品层次结构及逻辑清晰且必须是原创；</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">禁止发布广告类内容信息；</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">禁止发布涉政、暴恐、违禁等敏感内容。</font>

issueDTO.title: Add streaming support to vtkF3DSplatReader
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
F3D support reading splat, however this reader does not support streaming yet. We will need all reader to support streaming in the future, lets add it!

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Add an Streaming API to vtkF3DSplatReader by inheriting from vtkAbstractPolyDataReader
 - Implement that API in a similar way has the implement in vtkF3DSPZReader
 - Add test similar to TestF3DSPZReader

issueDTO.title: Add netcdf support
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
F3D is able to open many scivis format, but not netcdf, which should be easy to add, lets add it!

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Add a reader in hdf plugin for netcdf format using vtkNETCDFReader
 - Add associated logic for config files, mimetypes, VTK modules and such
 - Add tests
 - Add doc
 - Add test in F3D-Superbuild

issueDTO.title: JSON Reader Faster Coercion of Primitives to String
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem or challenge? Please describe what you are trying to do.**
While reviewing https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/pull/7263 from @zhuqi-lucas I noticed that the json reader is allocating a new for each string field it parses 

https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/blob/f4fde769ab6e1a9b75f890b7f8b47bc22800830b/arrow-json/src/reader/string_array.rs#L110-L120



**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like to make the json reader faster by not allocating in the inner loop

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

I think instead of doing 
```rust
for ... {
  builder.append_value(n.to_string())
}
```

A typically faster pattern is

```rust
// temp buffer
let mut s = String::new();

for ... {
  s.clear(); // reuse allocation
  write!(&mut s, "{n}");
  builder.append_value(s)
}
```
  

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
-->
comments:
You can run the json reader benchmark here:
```rust
cargo bench --bench json_reader
```

and compare before/after performance

Since this is well specified I think this would be a good first issue for anyone who wants to learn about low level rust optimization
BTW it may turn out that the suggested change doesn't improve performance -- but we can measure with the benchmark

I believe this codepath is only hit when coercing integer to strings, e.g.


```
{"a": 123}
```

Reading into a StringArray column, anything encoded as a string will be unaffected. E.g.

```
{"a": "123"}
```

So any benchmark would need to be doing this in order to see improvement

_It is also worth noting that parsing a primitive only to cast it back to a string is inherently wasteful, but avoiding this would be extremely difficult as the tape decoder is unaware of the schema_

Hi,

I realized I can send a PR for that and I implemented and sent it:  [https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/pull/7274](https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/pull/7274)

closing the [PR](https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/pull/7274).
I see that the performance is consistently BETTER even though it is not hitting the refactored code.
Will investigate.

I am not sending a PR because the performance did not improve.
Here is the [diff](https://github.com/apache/arrow-rs/compare/main...ndemir:ndemir/string-coerce-optimization?expand=1) you can see.

Here is what I did:
- I implemented the changes.
- I implemented a new test function in `json_writer.rs`, the new test function name is `bench_coerce_primitive`.
- I did benchmark: `main` branch vs that [new branch](https://github.com/ndemir/arrow-rs/tree/ndemir/string-coerce-optimization).

The results are not good.

```
bench_coerce_primitive  time:   [8.5429 ms 8.6018 ms 8.6619 ms]
                        change: [+3.7518% +4.8659% +5.9167%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has regressed.
```

That also made me think that if other similar changes are really statistically significant.
Thanks for trying @ndemir

I was able to speed the tape reading for number values. I think the bench written by @ndemir  does not specifically test the functionality that was changed. The tape reading function is called when `decoder.serialize().flush()` is called. Let me send out a PR with a different bench
take

issueDTO.title: Add pre-commit hook `pyupgrade` to auto upgrade Python syntax
issueDTO.description:
"A tool (and pre-commit hook) to automatically upgrade syntax for newer versions of the language."

https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade

https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade?tab=readme-ov-file#python2-and-old-python3x-blocks

Example `.pre-commit-config.yaml` entry:

```
  - repo: https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade
    rev: v3.19.1
    hooks:
      - id: pyupgrade
        args: [--py37-plus]
```

Availability:

- --py36-plus will remove Python <= 3.5 only blocks
- --py37-plus will remove Python <= 3.6 only blocks
    so on and so forth

issueDTO.title: [Feature] Adding ping via API - hostname requirement is redundant
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

I have to use the following request to create a ping test via the API. Note that both the host in the monitor section and host in the params section is required. However, this is redundant and the potential for confusion / misconfiguration if set in the wrong way. I would recommend not making the params entry required, and just use the host from the main monitor section.

```
{
  "monitor": {
    "name": "garage-door-car",
    "app": "ping",
    "host": "garage-door-car.goepp.net",
    "intervals": 60
  },
  "params": [
    {
      "field": "timeout",
      "paramValue": 6000
    },
    {
      "field": "host",
      "paramValue": "garage-door-car.goepp.net"
    }
  ]
}
```

### Expected Behavior

Only require one of the new host parameters.

### Steps To Reproduce

Nothing to reproduce here, just a comment on how the API works.

### Environment

```markdown
HertzBeat version(s): 1.7.0
```

### Debug logs

N/A

### Anything else?

Nope.
comments: This seems to be true of other tests also, like website.
Got it. We can handle it specially on the backend. For field `host` in params, use the monitor host value, remove its required attribute.

And others note, only for `ping` monitor, need use the root to run jvm to use `ping`, other it will telnet the target port 15 instead of `ping`. If start HertzBeat by docker, there is not this problem.

summary.main: The current behavior of the API requires both the host in the monitor section and host in the params section, which is redundant and can cause confusion. The issue needs to be fixed to only require one of the new host parameters.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the API to only require one of the new host parameters, eliminating the redundancy and potential for confusion/misconfiguration.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by handling the 'host' field in the 'params' section specially on the backend, using the monitor host value and removing the required attribute for the 'host' field in the 'params' section.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'feature' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant feature suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with detailed explanations of the changes made to address the redundant hostname requirement in the API.

issueDTO.title: Can we please have up to date manual installation docs?
issueDTO.description:
Hi Everyone,

I've tried following the manual install instructions on the website twice now and I've had to resort to docker each time. While docker is convenient for installation, operation and management is not ideal with docker. I've had to troubleshoot the timeline not working and the map not working a couple times, each time has been especially onerous compared to other photo gallery applications without Docker. 

Thanks! 


Tmanok
comments:
Hi @tmanok, thanks for reporting the issue.
The source of truth is the Readme in this repo. The docs website might be a bit (or more) outdated, and we'd appreciate contributions to keep it up-to-date.

While we still support direct deployment on the host, we recommend Docker-based deployment as the main way to install Photoview, as it gives perfect abstraction and unification across host OS and architectures. Nothing is ideal, but the Docker deployment is easier to maintain, so the direct deployment on the host is considered an advanced way for users, skilled and ready to solve some dependency and configuration issues, caused by their OS and architecture differences and nuances.

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request] Proxy for entrypoint
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I want to use proxies when calling apis, i.e., https_proxy=.... curl ... 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Some entrypoints need proxies, others don't. So they would better be customized with entrypoints.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Otherwise we can not use the app for the proxied models unless doing hack.

**Additional context**
I'd like to offer additional information if needed
comments:
Happy to take this on, it’s a simple but valuable enhancement. I’d add proxy support at the entrypoint level by allowing users to optionally specify an https_proxy or similar environment variable when initializing the app. I’ll ensure the configuration is non-breaking for users who don’t need it, and document best practices for cases with mixed proxy and direct endpoints.

Since I’ve dealt with network compliance and tool configuration across models, I know how subtle these proxy nuances can be. If there’s a preferred pattern for proxy injection or environment fallbacks in the app, I’ll align with that.

Let me know if you'd like a quick draft of the interface or env config to review!
Sounds great! I'd love to see a draft of the interface or env config. Looking forward to it!

issueDTO.title: Lasso/box selection switching and usage over existing layers
issueDTO.description:
We want to update dragging and selection such that:
- Ctrl+drag's lasso selection, upon releasing Ctrl, switches to a regular box selection, and back to lasso by holding Ctrl again. It draws a straight line between the cursor position last time the lasso was removed and when it's now restored, allowing the user to also use this as a technique for drawing straight line sections of the lasso, but also just to decide to use box selection instead of lasso at any time.
- Ctrl+dragging an *object* currently drags its layer(s) but we want to make it instead always lasso select. This lets the user perform a lasso selection over an existing layer, or a box selection but releasing Ctrl as in the previous bullet point.
- Lasso selection has a bug that should be fixed: aborting the lasso selection (RMB or Esc) then creating a new lasso selection ends up erroneously extending the previously drawn lasso path because abort fails to clear the lasso data (which also wastes memory!).
comments:
opened https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2792 to address the last issue mentioned:
> Lasso selection has a bug that should be fixed: aborting the lasso selection (RMB or Esc) then creating a new lasso selection ends up erroneously extending the previously drawn lasso path because abort fails to clear the lasso data (which also wastes memory!).
