issueDTO.title: [Bug] Compressed backups use unconventional file extensions
issueDTO.description:
<!--
Bugs should be filed for issues encountered whilst operating mariadb-operator.
Please provide as much detail as possible. 
-->

**Documentation**
- [x] I acknowledge that I have read the relevant [documentation](https://github.com/mariadb-operator/mariadb-operator/tree/main/docs).

**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. 
Tip: you can use 
```
<code here>
```
for code blocks of your kubectl output or YAML files.
-->
Gzip compressed backups have the file extensions in the wrong order. They are named:

`backup.2024-10-13T02_00_00Z.gzip.sql`

Which means you cannot just decompress them, since gzip does not recognize the .sql extension:

```
$ gunzip backup.2024-10-13T02_00_00Z.gzip.sql      
gzip: backup.2024-10-13T02_00_00Z.gzip.sql: unknown suffix -- ignored
```

It would be better if the files are called `*.sql.gz` so they can be recognized by tools like gunzip by default.
 
**Expected behaviour**
<!--A concise description of what you expected to happen.-->

**Steps to reproduce the bug**
<!--Steps to reproduce the bug should be clear and easily reproducible to help people
gain an understanding of the problem.-->

1. Create a gzip compressed backup.
2. Check the created filename.

**Environment details**:
- Kubernetes version: 1.30.5+k3s1
- Kubernetes distribution: k3s
- mariadb-operator version: 0.34.0
- Galera data-plane version (init and agent): N/A
- Install method: helm

**Additional context**
<!--Add any other context  here.-->
comments:
Hey @pkerwien ! Thanks for raising this.

Although I agree, we should follow conventional extensions to leverage existing tooling, this change implies breaking changes, as there will be user who already have backups taken with previous versions of the operator. For this reason, we should also think about the migration path as part of this issue. I'm thinking about the following options:
- Declare a breaking change in the release notes and provide a migration script.
- Include a migration step for old backups as part of the operator's backup subcommand.
This issue is stale because it has been open 60 days with no activity.

> Hey @pkerwien ! Thanks for raising this.
> 
> Although I agree, we should follow conventional extensions to leverage existing tooling, this change implies breaking changes, as there will be user who already have backups taken with previous versions of the operator. For this reason, we should also think about the migration path as part of this issue. I'm thinking about the following options:
> 
> * Declare a breaking change in the release notes and provide a migration script.
> * Include a migration step for old backups as part of the operator's backup subcommand.

2 cents here. The unusual file naming (Remembering that file extensions are useless for most of tools since magic is used to detect file properties and GUI associations - so doesn't calling it "extension") may break some automations. gzip and bzip2 when uncompress a file named with extension, get this extension removed from target file. In this inverted file naming, gzip and bzip2 are unable to automatically detect file content and properly remove the suffix of target filename.

That said: If mariadb-operator backup/restore tools uses proper command line detection (Use magic to detect proper file format instead file naming) and use complete command line syntax for compressors (`bzip2 -z` for compression, `bzip2 -d` for decompression - as stated in manpage to explicit operation), the operator will be resilient about extension changes and keeping old behaviour for existent backups with old filename, since these way to handle the files does not depend anymore of file proper suffix.

I know operator was wrote with Go, but using the shell tools is just to ilustrate my point in a SRE point of view as example.

A side question regarding the backup pipeline: why are backups compressed on the upload step (main container) instead of during mariadb-dump in the init container? Currently, for a 20G database, I need to provide at least 30G of storage in the staging PVC. With piped compression during mariadb-dump, it would probably be enough to allocate 10G.

> That said: If mariadb-operator backup/restore tools uses proper command line detection (Use magic to detect proper file format instead file naming) and use complete command line syntax for compressors (bzip2 -z for compression, bzip2 -d for decompression - as stated in manpage to explicit operation), the operator will be resilient about extension changes and keeping old behaviour for existent backups with old filename, since these way to handle the files does not depend anymore of file proper suffix.

@leleobhz Thank you for you insights, very useful suggestion. Removing the suffix dependency and instead do a detection based on the file would be great, this way no migration would be needed as it will be backwards compatible. I think it was actually the first approach that @vixns took when raising the PR. It would need to be accomodated and tested in the current codebase:
- https://github.com/vixns/mariadb-operator/blob/f7d96f79364b6985364ee70f59704c4c543eb818/cmd/backup/restore.go#L107
- https://github.com/vixns/mariadb-operator/blob/f7d96f79364b6985364ee70f59704c4c543eb818/cmd/backup/restore.go#L118

Contributions are welcome here! I would suggest to move the detection logic to our [backup pkg](https://github.com/mariadb-operator/mariadb-operator/tree/main/pkg/backup) and add a generous amount of unit tests, as it would become a critical function.

> A side question regarding the backup pipeline: why are backups compressed on the upload step (main container) instead of during mariadb-dump in the init container? Currently, for a 20G database, I need to provide at least 30G of storage in the staging PVC. With piped compression during mariadb-dump, it would probably be enough to allocate 10G.

@SPodjasek good question! We cannot do the compression on the MariaDB container because it lacks the bzip2 dependency (it only has gzip), we want to minimize the dependencies to reduce the attack surface and CVEs. Another good reason to do it in the go sidecar is the ease of testing, you can have unit tests to validate the compression function, whereas doing it on the main container will require an integration test.
This issue is stale because it has been open 60 days with no activity.
This issue is stale because it has been open 60 days with no activity.

summary.main: Gzip compressed backups have the file extensions in the wrong order, which makes it difficult to decompress the files using standard tools like gunzip. The expected behavior is to have the file extensions in the conventional order, allowing for easy decompression.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the compressed backups to have conventional file extensions, allowing for easy decompression using standard tools like gunzip.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by declaring a breaking change in the release notes and providing a migration script, or including a migration step for old backups as part of the operator's backup subcommand. Another approach is to use proper command line detection to detect the file format instead of relying on file naming conventions, which would make the operator resilient to extension changes and allow for backwards compatibility.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'stale', 'bug', 'help wanted', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. The issue is about compressed backups using unconventional file extensions, which makes it difficult to decompress the files using standard tools like gunzip. The expected behavior is to have the file extensions in the conventional order, allowing for easy decompression. The attempted fixes mentioned include declaring a breaking change in the release notes and providing a migration script, or including a migration step for old backups as part of the operator's backup subcommand. A side question regarding the backup pipeline is also raised, questioning why backups are compressed on the upload step instead of during mariadb-dump in the init container.

issueDTO.title: Allow to create additionalLabels in serviceMonitor section
issueDTO.description:
<!--
Bugs should be filed for issues encountered whilst operating mariadb-operator.
Please provide as much detail as possible. 
-->


**Describe the bug**
After trying different configurations, I am not able to add additionalLabels inside the serviceMonitor which could allow me to monitor specific mariadb instances. Checking the documentation [we only have ](https://github.com/mariadb-operator/mariadb-operator/blob/main/docs/METRICS.md#servicemonitor) we only have the following possibilities
```
    serviceMonitor:
      prometheusRelease: kube-prometheus-stack
      jobLabel: mariadb-monitoring
      interval: 10s
      scrapeTimeout: 10s
    username: monitoring
    passwordSecretKeyRef:
      name: mariadb
      key: password
```
However it is not enough for me as I would like to add some other additionalLabels.
**Expected behaviour**
<!--A concise description of what you expected to happen.-->
Being able to code something like:

```
    serviceMonitor:
      additionalLabels:
        release: "${values['global']['helmReleaseNamePrefix']}monitoring-platform"
      interval: 10s
      scrapeTimeout: 10s
    username: monitoring
    passwordSecretKeyRef:
      name: mariadb
      key: password
```
**Steps to reproduce the bug**
<!--Steps to reproduce the bug should be clear and easily reproducible to help people
gain an understanding of the problem.-->
additionalLabels or selector matchLabels are not being taken into account

**Debug information**
- Related object events:
```bash
kubectl get events --field-selector involvedObject.name=<mariadb-resource-name>
kubectl get events --field-selector involvedObject.name=<backup-resource-name>
kubectl get events --field-selector involvedObject.name=<restore-resource-name>
```
- `mariadb-operator` logs. Set the `--log-level` to `debug` if needed.

**Environment details**:
- mariadb-operator version: 0.30.0
- Install method: [helm]

**Additional context**
<!--Add any other context  here.-->
comments:
Hi,
I was able to fix the issue by using the label `prometheusRelease` to point into the Prometheus release just like
```   
        metrics:
          enabled: true
          serviceMonitor:
            prometheusRelease: "${values['global']['helmReleaseNamePrefix']}monitoring-platform"
```

However in my view, I still consider we should have `additionalLabels` in case we want to add some specific label to the serviceMonitor automatically created.

Adding a +1 here, as I am running in to something similar. Because $reasons we run multiple Prometheus instances in our cluster and we therefore have a need to specify which label to monitor on. Unfortunately using the `release` label doesn't work for us there since we already use that label for other purposes.

I have worked around the issue by using `inheritMetadata.labels`, but ideally I'd not do that because it sets the label on _all_ the created resources.
This issue is stale because it has been open 60 days with no activity.

Thanks for bringing this up. We could extend our `serviceMonitor` definition to have a map of `additionalLabels` as you suggested:

```yaml
serviceMonitor:
   additionalLabels:
      environment: production
      region: eu-west1
``` 

Which will result in the following `ServiceMonitor` getting reconciled:

```yaml
apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1
kind: ServiceMonitor
spec:
  endpoints:
  - port: metrics
    relabelings:
     - targetLabel: environment
       replacement: production
     - targetLabel: region
       replacement: eu-west1
``` 

See `ServiceMonitor` reference for further detail:
- https://prometheus-operator.dev/docs/api-reference/api/#monitoring.coreos.com/v1.ServiceMonitorSpec

Contributions are welcomed!

> Thanks for bringing this up. We could extend our `serviceMonitor` definition to have a map of `additionalLabels` as you suggested:
> 
> serviceMonitor:
>    additionalLabels:
>       environment: production
>       region: eu-west1
> 
> Which will result in the following `ServiceMonitor` getting reconciled:
> 
> apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1
> kind: ServiceMonitor
> spec:
>   endpoints:
>   - port: metrics
>     relabelings:
>      - targetLabel: environment
>        replacement: production
>      - targetLabel: region
>        replacement: eu-west1
> 
> See `ServiceMonitor` reference for further detail:
> 
>     * https://prometheus-operator.dev/docs/api-reference/api/#monitoring.coreos.com/v1.ServiceMonitorSpec
> 
> 
> Contributions are welcomed!

@mmontes11 I am not sure if that is exactly what @jpicara requested. We are also missing the feature for `serviceMonitor.additionalLablels`, but we just need the result to end up in `metadata.labels` of `ServiceMonitor` object (e.g. to work similar as most of the bitnami charts `servicemonitor.labels`). 

Example:
```
serviceMonitor:
   additionalLabels:
      prometheus: prod
```

```
apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1
kind: ServiceMonitor
metadata:
  labels:
    prometheus: prod
```

Actually, I think both requests are legit.

```yaml
apiVersion: k8s.mariadb.com/v1alpha1
kind: MariaDB
metadata:
  name: mariadb
spec:
  metrics:
    enabled: true
    serviceMonitor:
      metadata:
        metadata:
          labels:
            prometheus: prod
      relabelings:
       - targetLabel: environment
         replacement: production
       - targetLabel: region
         replacement: eu-west1
```

@jpicara You will be able to configure `relabelings` i.e. change Prometheus labels by specifying `spec.metrics.serviceMonitor.relabelings`. This will reconcile the following `ServiceMonitor`:

```yaml
apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1
kind: ServiceMonitor
spec:
  endpoints:
  - port: metrics
    relabelings:
     - targetLabel: environment
       replacement: production
     - targetLabel: region
       replacement: eu-west1
```

@mhanc Indeed, we should be able to provide labels in the `ServiceMonitor` object metadata so it can be matched by the Prometheus instance:
https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/blob/3d6314b7d552246c1c3e60c3f89b0efbef6270c0/charts/kube-prometheus-stack/values.yaml#L4063

We will be deprecating the `prometheusRelease` field, as the `release` label can be passed through the new `metadata` field. The resulting `ServiceMonitor` will be:

```yaml
apiVersion: monitoring.coreos.com/v1
kind: ServiceMonitor
metadata:
  labels:
    prometheus: prod
```

Contributions are welcome! Will try to make some room in the upcoming release if nobody raises a PR.
This issue is stale because it has been open 60 days with no activity.

issueDTO.title: Implement mgp object serialization
issueDTO.description: It would be useful if all objects from [`mgp`](https://github.com/memgraph/memgraph/blob/master/include/mgp.py) are `JSON` serializable, that is, that there is some kind of method that returns Python `Dict` of `mgp` objects. For example, when I'm writing a [query module for database export](https://github.com/memgraph/mage/pull/100), I'm actually creating a `JSON` file with a list of nodes and relationships. Therefore, I have to reach every label, property, etc. of each `Vertex` and `Edge`. I would like to be able to just add properties as a list to my properties key, but then `mgp.Vertex.properties` is not `JSON` serializable. I solved this by going through all properties and creating new dictionary, but I think that the right place for this code would be inside mgp and not query module. Since we're going to create new utility modules similar to the export one, this feature may come in handy.
comments:
Since we added the support for functions, there are more places where this type of functionality can fit:
* [Mage](https://github.com/memgraph/mage) because if this is implemented as a function, it could be used as a part of any expression
* As a ["built-in" Memgraph function](https://github.com/memgraph/memgraph/blob/master/src/query/interpret/awesome_memgraph_functions.hpp)

issueDTO.title: Use constraints as indices if possible
comments: @Josipmrden, did we implement this? I think so. Can you link the PRs implementing this and close this issue?

Memgraph's current architecture creates a skip list for each uniqueness constraint and index.

Typically, you would have the index on uniqueness constraint. This presents a 2x memory reduction on the total number of nodes:

10 milion nodes with application ID = 1GB (approximately)
10 milion nodes with index on application ID = 2 GB (approximately)
10 milion nodes with a constraint on the application ID = 3GB (approximately)
Scaling this by a factor of 10:
100M nodes = 10GB
100M nodes + index = 20GB
100M nodes + index + constraint = 30GB
Scaling this  by a factor of 10
1B = 100GB
1B nodes + index = 200GB
1B  nodes + index + constraint = 300GB

Previous attempts: https://github.com/memgraph/memgraph/pull/1356

issueDTO.title: [CLI] Improve confirmation UX with better options (like Claude's arrow interface)
issueDTO.description:
## Problem
The current confirmation interface is limited and forces users into a cumbersome workflow when they want to provide alternative instructions instead of just yes/no.

## Current Behavior
```
Proceed with action? (y)es/(n)o/(a)lways >
```

When users want to give different instructions:
1. Type "N" + Enter
2. Wait for prompt
3. Type their alternative instructions

## Expected Behavior (inspired by Claude)
```
Proceed with action?
→ Yes, proceed
  No, let me give different instructions
  Always proceed (don't ask again)

Or type your alternative instructions directly:
> 
```

## User Experience Issues
- **Workflow interruption**: Must say no, then explain what to do instead
- **Inefficient**: Extra steps when user wants to provide guidance
- **Unclear options**: Limited to yes/no/always

## Proposed Enhanced UX
1. **Arrow navigation**: Use arrow keys to select options
2. **Direct input**: Allow typing instructions directly at confirmation prompt
3. **More options**: 
   - Yes, proceed
   - No, skip this action
   - Always proceed (don't ask again)
   - Let me provide different instructions
4. **Inline editing**: Type alternative instructions directly

## Example Enhanced Interface
```
Command
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│ $ rm important_file.txt             │
└─────────────────────────────────────┘

Choose an option:
→ Yes, proceed
  No, skip this action  
  Always proceed
  Give different instructions

Or type alternative instructions:
> Instead, move the file to backup/ folder
```

## Technical Context
This would require enhancing the `read_confirmation_input()` function in `openhands/cli/tui.py` to support:
- Arrow key navigation
- Multiple choice selection
- Direct text input as alternative

## Related Files
- `openhands/cli/tui.py` (read_confirmation_input function)
- `openhands/cli/main.py` (confirmation handling in on_event_async)
comments:
Are we particularly attached to prompt_toolkit for the CLI interface? Not trying to reinvent wheels, but there are a couple of Terminal UI-focused projects that might be worth checking out while the CLI is still young. If prompt_toolkit is locked in, that’s all good too. Solid library.

Charm is the TUI toolkit that I’ve been absorbing over time, the only downer is that it’s built with Go and usually that doesn’t jive with JS/Python shops.

https://charm.sh - Specifically, Bubbletea/bubbles for components, Lipgloss for CSS-like declarative styling, huh for HTML-style forms etc… I just love their stuff.

import mgclient

@stefanak-michal could you please double-check that the issue is not somewhere inside the PHP Bolt library?

issueDTO.title: Implement a COLLECT subquery that correctly handles null values
issueDTO.description:
Aggregation function `collect(t.id, p.id);` automatically ignores null values and doesn't add them to the list; the returned collection does not contain any nulls. 

**Feature request:** Implement COLLECT subquery which will not remove null values automatically.
https://neo4j.com/docs/cypher-manual/current/subqueries/collect/#collect-differentiation

Example dataset and queries:
```
CREATE (:project {id: '1'})-[:HAS]->(:Task {id: '1'})-[:ASSIGNED_TO]->(:Person {id:'1'})
CREATE (:project {id: '1'})-[:HAS]->(:Task {id: '2'})-[:ASSIGNED_TO]->(:Person {id:'2'})
CREATE (:project {id: '1'})-[:HAS]->(:Task {id: '3'})-[:ASSIGNED_TO]->(:Person {id:'3'})
CREATE (:project {id: '1'})-[:HAS]->(:Task {id: '4'})
CREATE (:project {id: '1'})-[:HAS]->(:Task {id: '5'})

//running the following query correctly fills out non-assigned tasks with null for a person:
MATCH (:project {id: '1'})--(t:Task)
OPTIONAL MATCH (t)-[:ASSIGNED_TO]-(p:Person)
RETURN t.id, p.id;

//running the collect function doesn't return the tasks with a null person:
MATCH (:project {id: '1'})--(t:Task)
OPTIONAL MATCH (t)-[:ASSIGNED_TO]-(p:Person)
RETURN collect(t.id, p.id);

//WORKAROUND: forcing the person id into a list includes the null values:
MATCH (:project {id: '1'})--(t:Task)
OPTIONAL MATCH (t)-[:ASSIGNED_TO]-(p:Person)
RETURN collect(t.id, [p.id]);
```
comments: A good way to start addressing this issue might be to review the `Aggregate` implementation in `operator.hpp` and `operator.cpp` to see how Memgraph handles null values. I suggest checking the `ProcessAll` and `ProcessOne` functions.
This is very important feature that doesn't seem to work. please fix it.

repository.description: Open-source graph database, tuned for dynamic analytics environments. Easy to adopt, scale and own.
repository.name: memgraph

summary.main: The COLLECT subquery in Memgraph currently ignores null values and does not add them to the list, resulting in the returned collection not containing any nulls. The issue needs to be fixed so that the COLLECT subquery correctly handles null values and returns the tasks with a null person.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the COLLECT subquery to correctly handle null values and return the tasks with a null person. The COLLECT function should not automatically remove null values. The returned collection should contain all null values.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by reviewing the `Aggregate` implementation in `operator.hpp` and `operator.cpp` to see how Memgraph handles null values. The `ProcessAll` and `ProcessOne` functions should be checked to understand how Memgraph handles null values. The workaround is to force the person id into a list, which includes the null values.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'OPEN' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. The issue requires the implementation of a COLLECT subquery that correctly handles null values in Memgraph. issueDTO.title: Multiple server IP addresses to connect to as a list
issueDTO.description:
**Imported issue:**
- Author: Ehryk Menze
- Date: 2013-09-19 05:33:47
- Legacy ID: 3735

**Detail:**

I'd like to be able to enter multiple server addresses for my clients to connect to. I use my laptop as a client at work and at home - to connect to two different servers with completely different IP addresses and names.

**Example:** _Server IP: 192.168.1.12,10.104.12.92,PC469_

Expected: Allow a , or ; separated list of IP addresses to search for Synergy servers. If more than one are available, it should take the first listed as having higher priority.

Optional: Allow the selection of 'continue polling while connected' (switching to a higher-priority server if it appears while connected to a lower-priority one) optionally, and if disabled only check for servers on disconnect.

**Versions and operating systems:**

All

**Temporary workarounds:**

Manually changing the client's IP address every time (twice/day for me). Annoying.

**Similar bugs:**

[Issue #388](http://synergy-foss.org/spit/issues/details/388/) is the desire for a command-line version of this.
comments:
- Author: Jamie Smith
- Date: 2014-10-07 11:46:29

I came looking for this feature request after running into [#4042](http://synergy-project.org/spit/issues/details/4072/) continually when taking my laptop between home and work and having to stop and change the IP then continually restart the client until it kept working. Seeing as it seems to be the restarting of the client that makes it crash a nice solution for me would be for it to roll over to a new server IP once the main one is lost.
Yes! This is exactly what I need too. I'd even be willing to add to my donation to have this feature ;-P
Can one bind 2 synergy client instances to 2 different IP's... Docker?
I also request this feature, using the paid version and it's just irritating to change the ip every time i want to use synergy at work or at home. this is a must have feature.
Work-around: Set the hostname on your DHCP's to be the same thing in both locations, then use hostname instead of IP. I do this, and it works happily. But, it is not a fix.
i doubt that my boss will let me play around with our dhcp just for my little gadget so this will not work out for me. I require this feature very badly.

I require this too and surprised it doesnt have it out of the box, i work with 3 different computers and typing adress manually is a pain and sometimes the adresses change, would be useful if you could at least save ip and click and button.

Will this ever be implemented?
I don't mind building it but could anyone direct me roughly where in the code that would be?
This can be done by configuring avahi in both synergy servers so they have the same mDNS name.

Is this going to happen eventually?  Seems like from a technical standpoint it would be a really easy improvement.  At least in my case only one of the two server computers is on/available on the network at a time so if you have two IP addresses, connect to whichever one you can and you're good!
This is a great feature to have and essential for some.

Another use case for this: Sometimes-on VPN client won't allow local LAN connectivity, but local router won't hairpin LAN clients to inbound NAT forward rule. So I have to stop and start the synergy client with a different host/port whenever I toggle between VPN.
+1 for this, I regularly switch between LAN / WiFi but still need to control...

I have a computer that's connected to another on a local /30 connection for the sake of latency, and another on the wifi. I achieved multiple listening IPs by using 0.0.0.0, which causes the agent to bind to all IP addresses.

I agree that it would be nice to specify a list for the sake of security, but this is an adequate workaround for my situation
In the context of Synergy 1, this sounds like a useful issue, and I'd love to see it implemented. It'd also be nice if it remembered the IPs you connected to previously.
+1 for this.

Do I remember correctly that  if you use a DNS name Deskflow already tries all the returned IP addresses in order to establish a connection? I.e. there is logic to try multiple addresses until one succeeds ... it seems it's just not plugged through the full stack.

> Do I remember correctly that if you use a DNS name Deskflow already tries all the returned IP addresses in order to establish a connection? I.e. there is logic to try multiple addresses until one succeeds ... it seems it's just not plugged through the full stack.

We do not do any logic to try additional addresses, if you type in a name you should get the name resolved via DNS

edited for clarity

The Logic is : i regularly use 3 different servers with 3 different dns name and 3 different ip on 3 completely different networks with a laptop configured as client. It would be nice if I don’t have to change the name or ip of the server each time I change network.
Looks like I’m not the only one thinking that…

edit: updated the comment above

> The Logic is : i regularly use 3 different servers with 3 different dns name and 3 different ip on 3 completely different networks with a laptop configured as client. It would be nice if I don’t have to change the name or ip of the server each time I change network.
Looks like I’m not the only one thinking that…

This feature as described here will not happen what is likely to happen is some kind of "Profile" support. Where you will be able to selected a profile. While working on that we can discuss how roaming between profiles may work.

Problem with profile is that you need to click something on the client. Which means you need a physical mouse, just for selecting the profile.
The possibility to enter a small list of server (either name or IP address) seems simpler and doesn't bother the basic user (they won't even know it's there).
I have to admit that I don't understand what's the problem with that feature...

> Problem with profile is that you need to click something on the client. Which means you need a physical mouse, just for selecting the profile.

 Maybe profiles can have triggers based on the network ssid( if wifi) or ip if wired or network profile if using network manager or something else. changing of profiles does not have to be completely manual . That is what i ment by "While working on that we can discuss how roaming between profiles may work."

Also your client is moving around places i think its rather safe to assume its laptop, no ?

No it’s not a laptop.

What’s the problem about allowing few server  ip and/or name ?

The function should be able to handle different types of strings and should be able to handle edge cases.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the function to correctly transform a string to a List type, without losing any information or causing errors. The function should be able to handle different types of strings and should be able to handle edge cases.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by creating a new function that takes a string as input and returns a List type. This function should be able to handle different types of strings, such as comma-separated values, JSON arrays, etc. The function should also be able to handle edge cases, such as empty strings or strings with invalid characters.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue' and 'customer', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. The issue is related to adding a function to transform a string to a List type, which is important for vector search because embeddings are currently in string format and there is no easy way to transform it to a List.

issueDTO.title: The `podman volume export` command should refuse to write to STDOUT if it is a TTY
issueDTO.description:
### Issue Description

During a quick demo today, I noticed that `podman volume export testVol` with no redirection after will quite happily print the raw contents of tar to STDOUT. This could cause issues with the terminal if things like control characters are printed, and honestly doesn't seem useful at all; outputting to STDOUT only really makes sense if it's being piped into another command or redirected into a file.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

Steps to reproduce the issue
1. podman volume create testVol
2. podman run -v testVol:/data --rm alpine sh -c "echo hello > /data/myfile"
3. podman volume export testVol


### Describe the results you received

```
$ podman volume export testvol
myfile0000644000000000000000000000000615026530174010453 0ustar0000000000000000hello
```

### Describe the results you expected

An error message refusing to export when STDOUT is a terminal.

issueDTO.title: Positional arguments are not supported with `optional_var_files`
comments: There is actually no special processing that assumes the `arguments` property is a pair in the code. Did you you observe unexpected behaviors when you try to run this? Can you share the terragrunt logs for the runs where it didn't work as expected?

Hi thanks for the reply.  Please see below:

terragrunt version v0.19.27 // Terraform v0.12.13

```
09:44 $ TERRAGRUNT_DEBUG=true terragrunt apply
[terragrunt] 2019/11/05 09:44:28 Reading Terragrunt config file at <redacted>/prod/terragrunt.hcl
[terragrunt] [<redacted>/prod] 2019/11/05 09:44:28 Running command: terraform --version
[terragrunt] 2019/11/05 09:44:29 Detected 1 Hooks
[terragrunt] 2019/11/05 09:44:29 Running command: terraform apply <redacted>/prod/terraform_prod.tfplan -var-file=<redacted>/prod/../../prod.tfvars
Too many command line arguments. Configuration path expected.
[terragrunt] 2019/11/05 09:44:29 errors.MultiError Hit multiple errors:
exit status 1
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/errors/multierror.go:24 (0x1278b12)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/cli/cli_app.go:444 (0x18de5dc)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/cli/cli_app.go:425 (0x18de297)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/cli/cli_app.go:313 (0x18dd02a)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/cli/cli_app.go:227 (0x18dcb31)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/cli/cli_app.go:208 (0x18dc85e)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/vendor/github.com/urfave/cli/app.go:490 (0x1879f38)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/vendor/github.com/urfave/cli/app.go:264 (0x18781ad)
/go/src/github.com/gruntwork-io/terragrunt/main.go:23 (0x18e51a4)
/usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:201 (0x102bba7)
	main: if raceenabled {
/usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1333 (0x1057b91)
	goexit: 
```

Thanks for sharing the logs!

As a sanity check, do you have `required_var_files` and `optional_var_files` in the `extra_arguments` block?

~~Nope, it's literally a working example of how to recreate this behaviour.~~

Yes, required_var_files (sorry, long day!).
In that case, does it work if you flip the order of the `-var-file` arg and the state file arg?

Ok I think this might be solved and it isn't actually a bug.  Re your suggestion above, that results in this error:

```
Error: Can't set variables when applying a saved plan

The -var and -var-file options cannot be used when applying a saved plan file,
because a saved plan includes the variable values that were set when it was
created.
```

So since Terraform doesn't support passing -var-file to apply, once you remove -var-file and optional -var-file, all works as expected with the config below.

```
/* apply args */
  extra_arguments "apply_args" {
    commands = [
      "apply"
    ]

    arguments = [
      "-lock=true",
      "-lock-timeout=60s",
      "${get_terragrunt_dir()}/terraform_${basename(path_relative_to_include())}.tfplan"
    ]
  }

  /* vars args */
  extra_arguments "vars" {
    commands = [
      "destroy",
      "plan",
      "import",
      "push",
      "refresh"
    ]

    # .tfvars for set variables
    # .vars for declared variables
    required_var_files = [
      "${get_terragrunt_dir()}/../../${basename(path_relative_to_include())}.tfvars"
    ]

    # optional_var_files = [
    # ]
  }
```

Thanks for helping to get to the bottom of this.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for raising this issue.

summary.main: The issue is that Terragrunt does not support positional arguments with `optional_var_files`, causing problems when trying to create a plan with -out and apply the plan. This is a significant issue that affects the usability of Terragrunt.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for Terragrunt to support positional arguments with `optional_var_files`, allowing users to create a plan with -out and apply the plan. However, this is not currently possible due to the limitations of `optional_var_files`.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix involves adjusting the configuration to use `required_var_files` instead of `optional_var_files`, and removing the `-var-file` argument. This allows the plan to be created and applied successfully.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'stale', 'bug', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. The issue is related to positional arguments not being supported with `optional_var_files` in Terragrunt, causing issues with creating a plan with -out and applying the plan. The problem is not reproducible with `required_var_files`.

issueDTO.title: [Bug] NPC Import Feature Allows Unrestricted Server Command Execution
issueDTO.description:
**Minecraft and Mod version** 🐞
Minecraft version: 1.20.1 
Mod version: 5.9.0

**Describe the bug** 🐞
This glitch requires a little bit of setup but for how powerful the glitch is it will definitely be worth the setup. To do this glitch you need to go into a singleplayer world and spawn in an npc, for this I used the allay npc. Go into actions and into the on interact action, from here make sure the data type is COMMAND and in the command line you have to execute as another player for this example i used /execute as @p[name=!Congeesetador] run op Congeesetador by adding the !Congeesetador it ignores me and looks for another player to execute the command as since I don't have op permissions, this other player can be anyone in the server as long as its not you. You can also add more lines of commands to activate multiple at the same time adding to the destruction possible. After you finish writing your commands you have to export the npc settings to save them for later. After exporting head back onto the server you want to run these commands on and spawn in an npc, it has to be the same npc that you used in the singleplayer world, since I used an allay I had to spawn an allay to get the export settings. After exporting you are able to interact with the npc and the commands will execute without any problems and run whatever you put in them including /op, To add onto this the person who is the "target" of the execute command will not be notified of this at all meaning it is undetectable under normal circumstances, since I am not a part of the staff team of this server just a simple bug tester I do not have access to the console to see if anything was written there but if you do op yourself you will show on the list of operators for everyone to see. This is a very dangerous bug that should be handled as quick as possible.



**To Reproduce** ⚙️
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Join a singleplayer world
2. Spawn an NPC (for this I used an allay, I haven't attempted it with other npc mobs as of now)
3. Click on Actions and On Interact action and ensure the data type is COMMAND
4. In the command line have an execute command that is excluding yourself as a target and have it run whatever command you wish such as /op. Example: /execute as @p[name=!Congeesetador] run op Congeesetador
5. Export the npc settings to save it on your computer
6. Join the server you wish you run the commands on and spawn an npc of the same type as the singleplayer one
7. Import the settings of the saved npc and do NOT change any of its settings as it will break the glitch and nothing will happen.
8. After importing close the config menu of the npc and interact with the npc to run the commands you have given it




**Expected behavior** ✔️
When performing this glitch any command at all will execute if done correctly, the possibilities for this glitch are endless as you can run whatever command you desire.

**Screenshots** 📸
I don't have screenshots of it since it would be a bit hard to show but I have a clip of me performing the glitch on the server, this was my first attempt at the glitch before I refined it as I thought you needed an admin to be next to the npc for it to work which was later debunked, I had an admin sit next to the npc for testing and i was able to op myself using the glitch, I also added a few more commands to verify that it did in fact run the commands. Note that before doing this exploit I was not opped and had no special permissions for anything other than being in a creative world with access to the npc mod.

https://medal.tv/games/minecraft/clips/kx666f6VfBwaUG1Th?invite=cr-MSx5NzUsMjA5MzkzODQ5 

**Is the issue happening in combination with other mods? (If yes, please provide a full list)** 🧩
This glitch is solely using the Easy NPC mod and nothing else is being used while performing the glitch, but just for reference the modpack we are use is the SteamCraft Modpack by LordMaximus05 which I will link below to show a list of all the mods for the server, though I used none of these mods during the process it could possibly be useful to check it out in case something is affecting it.

https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/modpacks/steamcraft-modpack-2


**Additional context** 📝
This is really my first time using Github to post a bug report if you wish to talk more about this you can add me on discord, my username is congeesetador, shoot me a message on there if needed.
comments:
Thank you very much for your very detailed issue report! Your description really helped to immediately spot the issue, understand its impact, and see exactly why it happens.

Currently, this behavior is by design. The mod is intended to give trusted creative mode users and server operators powerful tools to create interactive NPCs, including running commands. 
There are already some basic safety checks, but as you noticed, anyone with creative mode access and the ability to import or export NPCs can theoretically spawn or configure NPCs that execute almost any command. 
This is similar to what is possible with command blocks and other creative-only tools in Minecraft.

The main idea is that the current version assumes creative mode users are trusted, while survival or adventure users are not. If a player can use creative mode and import or export NPCs, they already have access to many other ways to affect the server, not just through this mod.

I already had something like this on my roadmap for future versions, but up to now the mod was not designed to restrict every possible action. However, based on your feedback, I will work on a quick fix for 1.20.1 to disallow the use of some specific server commands through NPCs and will add more controls with the next major updates. This will also include the possibility to restrict certain actions behind OP level or other permissions.

Creative mode in Minecraft is inherently not a safe mode. Anyone with access to creative can already use command blocks, structure blocks, and other features to perform similar or even more critical actions. For public servers or larger communities, I always recommend restricting creative and NPC import and export permissions to trusted staff.

If you have any ideas or suggestions on how the ideal permission system for NPC actions should look, I would really appreciate your feedback. Input from server operators and players is very helpful for building a system that works well in practice.

Thanks again for bringing this to my attention and for helping to improve the mod’s security for everyone.

I have released a quickfix in version 5.9.2 for 1.20.1 that disallows and logs the execution of server-relevant commands via NPC actions. 
This should help prevent potential abuse of critical server commands.

> I have released a quickfix in version 5.9.2 for 1.20.1 that disallows and logs the execution of server-relevant commands via NPC actions. This should help prevent potential abuse of critical server commands.

Thank you! the way the server was setup was for the public to have access to a creative dimension for building things to save and bring back to the survival dimension, the creative dimension hasn't been released to the public yet but I was experimenting with everything to see if there were any game breaking bugs that came along with it and ended up finding that out, in this creative dimension even though you have creative mode you are unable to open command blocks or anything of that sort unless you are opped and your inventory is completely separate from the survival dimension to prevent items from being transferred, This was quite the nasty one as any server who might have a public creative world where people could access the npc could very easily take over the server. Thank you for your quick work!
This issue is stale because it has been open 7 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment or this will be closed in 3 days.

issueDTO.title: [Feature]: Overall tests improvement and speedup
issueDTO.description:
### 🚀 The feature, motivation and pitch

Currently, vLLM test suite are often very expensive and takes a long time to setup and run (approx 1h for the full suite).

Majority of these times spent are at our frontend code.

Given that API logics are relatively complex (OpenAI vs. API server), we can speed up by mocking and keep e2e to a minimum.

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Before submitting a new issue...

- [x] Make sure you already searched for relevant issues, and asked the chatbot living at the bottom right corner of the [documentation page](https://docs.vllm.ai/en/latest/), which can answer lots of frequently asked questions.
comments:
Hi,
may I take this over?

Hi @aarnphm ,

could you specify your request a bit further, please?
I had a look at the overwhelming amount of tests today, is it correct that I should check in any test if it utilizes an openai or API server and if so, instead of spinning up a server instance just mocking them?
Or should I focus on the tests in the openai respectively entrypoints (for api) folder and thin them out?

Thanks for clarification
Best,
Paul

Hi Paul,

I think we can try to mock out all of the openai-related tests here.

We can start with a small subsets on v1 first, then proceed further

I would imagine this will persist a couple of PRs

Alright thank you, accordingly, I will have a look at the `vllm/tests/v1` dir tomorrow.
BR

Hi @aarnphm ,

sorry for bothering you again:
tbh, I am still figuring out what to do.

e.g. there are no imports of the `vllm.entrypoints.openai` module within the `tests/v1` directory.

```bash
(base) paolovic@xyz v1 % pwd
/dev/vllm/tests/v1
(base) paolovic@xyz v1 % grep -iIrn vllm.entrypoints.openai .
(base) paolovic@xyz v1
```

From your original post, I assumed you want me to change existing text.
Now I am not so sure anymore.

Sorry for the inconveniences, I am a new contributor that's why I am struggling a bit with your requirements.
Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
Paul

issueDTO.title: Limit dag run history by number of runs
issueDTO.description:
Currently dagu limits history for dag run by number of days by defining configuration at global level via base.yaml or individual dag levels. This feature is very useful for cron jobs. For non cron jobs, it may never get used. For non cron jobs, the history of dag runs should be limited by the number of runs rather than number of days.

As suggested by @yottahmd, we can add something like this:
```yaml
historyRetention:
  runs: 3 # Limit by runs
  days: 5 # Limit by days
```
comments:
Thank you for submitting the issue. Here’s a proposed design with minimal changes:
```yaml
# keep the last 5 runs
historyRetentionRuns: 5

# keep for the last 5 days (already supported)
historyRetentionDays: 5
```
It should result in validation error when both specified.

To-Do:
- Implement `historyRetentionRuns` field and clean up logic
- Add unit tests
- Update documentation
- Update json schema

repository.description: Local-first workflow engine, built for self-hosting. Alternative to Airflow, Cron, etc. It aims to solve greater problems.
repository.name: dagu

summary.main: The issue is about limiting the dag run history by number of runs for non-cron jobs, rather than number of days. The current configuration limits history by number of days, which may not be suitable for non-cron jobs. The proposed design suggests adding a new field to the configuration file to achieve this.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the dag run history to be limited by the number of runs for non-cron jobs, and by the number of days for cron jobs. The configuration file should allow users to specify both limits, and the validation should ensure that either one or the other is specified, but not both.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding a new field 'historyRetentionRuns' to the configuration file, allowing users to limit the history of dag runs by the number of runs. The existing 'historyRetentionDays' field should be kept for cron jobs. The validation logic should be updated to check for both fields and throw an error if both are specified.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with the proposed design and implementation details.

issueDTO.title: Normalize contribution docs with Toga
issueDTO.description:
### What is the problem or limitation you are having?

Briefcase has a contribution guide for docs and code; so does Toga. However, there are some elements of the Toga docs that would be useful to include in the Briefcase docs. 

### Describe the solution you'd like

Replicate the sections of the Toga contribution guides that aren't Toga-specific in the Briefcase docs. For example, we don't need the discussion about core and backends; but we *do* need the section about not submitting from your main branch, and waiting for feedback.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Consolidate these docs upstream (on the beeware.org website) so that the content isn't duplicated unnecessarily. However, developing a good narrative flow with an external site like that may be complex.

### Additional context

See also beeware/toga#2453, beeware/rubicon-objc#427
comments: A sync between the Toga and Briefcase contribution guides is in progress.

issueDTO.title: Month picker label is difficult to read after clicked
issueDTO.description:
### Where did this happen?

Local code with an up-to-date main branch, Production app

### Expected Behavior

When the current day is selected in the month picker, the day label is visible.

### Current Behavior

The day label does not have enough contrast with the filled circle, making it difficult to read.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fd1f897-3e54-400e-8130-84119788d09c

 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the month view by clicking the calendar icon in the bottom left icon row or typing `shift + 2`
2. Click on the current day in the month picker
3. Notice: the day label is impossible to read

### Possible Solution

Update the datepicker colors to allow this to work. Take care to stay consistent with the colors we already have in `colors.ts` as much as possible. If you need to adjust, try to adjust the brightness instead of introducing an entirely new color. Staying aligned with our color theme will make it easier to add future color themes.

### Context

This makes it difficult to use the month picker
comments:
I’d like to work on this issue by identifying the style change triggered after clicking the month picker and updating the label’s color or contrast using Tailwind CSS or scoped styles to improve readability. I’m the right person for this because I pay close attention to UI/UX details and have experience fixing similar visual issues in production interfaces.

ETA 12hrs

issueDTO.title: Support uploading applications from a stream
issueDTO.description:
The server, at the moment, supports application uploads via `/install-application` install from url ([ref](https://github.com/calimero-network/core/blob/5df4567699a42d6bba36555c32f8a1b08580a49b/crates/server/src/admin/handlers/applications/install_application.rs)) and `/dev/install-dev-application` install from path ([ref](https://github.com/calimero-network/core/blob/5df4567699a42d6bba36555c32f8a1b08580a49b/crates/server/src/admin/handlers/applications/install_dev_application.rs))

Which impairs the ability to install applications from a pipe (`meroctl`) or from a file upload (webui).

On the node, installation eventually reads from a stream so that we can expose this to the API and eventually `meroctl`.

The installation should still take in some optional expected hash & size, to aid a sanity-check.

issueDTO.title: [BUG]: Not checking for null value when cleaning email text
issueDTO.description:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current Behavior

```Error retrieving email with id abc123: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'replace'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/render/project/src/backend/utils/email_utils.py", line 113, in get_email
    email_data["to"] = clean_whitespace(mime_msg.get("To"))
                       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/opt/render/project/src/backend/utils/email_utils.py", line 19, in clean_whitespace
    return text.replace("\n", "").replace("\r", "").replace("\t", "")
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

This happens if the app processes an email that matches the job filters that does not have a To field (presumably you are blind copied bcc-ed). Example below

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/538b8591-a464-45a8-aaaf-f681abe8a2a4)

### Expected Behavior

Should check for nulls before calling the `clean_whitespace` function on `mime_msg.get("To")`

### Steps To Reproduce

**Follow these steps first for DIY install**: https://github.com/just-a-job-app/jobseeker-analytics/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md
Then:
1. Send yourself an email (bcc your gmail / google workspace address) with the subject line "next steps" ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a285cc35-dba5-43d9-af9b-6ab154cd6475) 
2. Truncate `processing_task_runs`, `users`, and `user_emails` table 
You can do this in DBeaver, see below example
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fa6f3e2a-c497-47f0-93dc-a15c1dfe0ba5)
3. Login with Google at `localhost:3000`
4. Click Continue as many times as necessary to get to the pick a start date calendar picker modal
5. Select 1 day before you got the "next steps" email to account for UTC time weirdness
6. As the app starts processing emails "eating rejections for dinner", check in your terminal logs to make sure the error shows up
7. Now add your fix into the code, repeat steps 2 through 5. As the app starts processing emails, you shouldn't see the error anymore. Now you're ready to push your code and have it reviewed :)

### Environment

```markdown
- OS: MacOS 15.5 
- Node: 
- npm:
```

### Criteria for Completion

- [ ] When an email that matches job-related filters does not have a "To" field, `clean_whitespace` should not be called on an empty value

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I've read the Code of Conduct and understand my responsibilities as a member of the Just a Job App Community
comments: Assigning myself until I get confirmation that current contributors don't want to hop on this :) Then will open it up to the public.

issueDTO.title: Fix: UI Bugs in User Portal's Sidebar, Icons, and Profile Display
issueDTO.description:
### **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Several UI/UX issues were previously identified in the Talawa User Portal:
- Missing icons in the sidebar (e.g., "My Organizations", "Chat").
- Content slightly overlapping with the sidebar.
- Incorrect element used for user profile (used `ProfileDropdown` instead of `ProfileCard`).
- Displaying `null null` as user name.
- Incorrect rendering of chat icon as `?`.
- Sidebar toggle interaction was not intuitive or consistent.

These issues led to visual inconsistency and poor user experience.

---

### **Describe the solution you'd like**

- Fixed all identified UI bugs.
- Implemented a consistent and smooth sidebar toggling mechanism.
- Replaced incorrect components (e.g., `ProfileDropdown`) with the appropriate one (`ProfileCard`).
- Updated the rendering logic to ensure icons and user data load reliably.

---

### **Additional context**

- Before

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/115b3e85-ce92-4ec3-8ec2-a9dba07ef236)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/049e6b83-985f-4ab6-bb08-d0e994477116)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0e8b057c-4aa6-423f-8170-a5fa08d95e8f

- After

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56d90953-4d48-4835-943c-a679ba8f7eeb

---

issueDTO.title: Two wishes
issueDTO.description: On Android :1. I hope to display the icon and text prompt of the current front or rear camera on the main screen. 2. Add two desktop widgets for quick start of front and rear camera recording. 3.The notification bar can provide other icon options, such as the running icon, the shield icon, etc., instead of just the "demon" icon.
comments:
> 1. I hope to display the front or rear camera on the main screen. 2. Add two desktop widgets for quick start of front and rear camera recording. Thank you

can you please explain more. Do you mean to record with both cameras at the same time? and in main screen the preview is already shown so can you elaborate more
Thanks

> > 1. I hope to display the front or rear camera on the main screen. 2. Add two desktop widgets for quick start of front and rear camera recording. Thank you
> 
> can you please explain more. Do you mean to record with both cameras at the same time? and in main screen the preview is already shown so can you elaborate more Thanks

It's not that simple. Using both the front and rear cameras simultaneously can be quite challenging. What I mean is, when I open the app, I don't know which camera is currently in use—front or rear. This requires me to go into settings to confirm, which can hinder quick video recording. It would be more convenient if there were an icon with a text label indicating which camera is currently active, such as 'Front Camera Activated.' This way, I could switch between the cameras as needed.

Alright now i understand. And for the quick widget, I'll think about it but right now there is already a quick shortcut for toggling recording. But it is according to the saved camera preference like if in app you selected front, this shortcut will toggle front camera and if it's saved as back then it will toggle back camera. I'll see if i can provide more widgets with camera ids already hardcoded.
And the notification customization already has preset options with different icons like downloading, sync. I think you mean the app icon which appears in the notification that you want to change, this is challenging, and i think android doesn't let us change that but I'll look if it's possible.

issueDTO.title: Live monitoring dashboard box layout misalignment in various terminal widths
issueDTO.description: When using the ccusage blocks --live command to display the real-time token usage monitoring dashboard, the box borders become misaligned in certain terminal widths. The right border (│) appears to be offset or "jumps" to incorrect positions, breaking the visual layout of the dashboard. Steps to Reproduce 1. Install ccusage: npm i -g ccusage 2. Run the live monitoring mode: ccusage blocks --live 3. Resize your terminal window to different widths 4. Observe that the right border of the box becomes misaligned Expected Behavior The dashboard should display a perfectly aligned box with all borders (┌─┐│└┘) forming a proper rectangle, regardless of the terminal width. All lines should have consistent width and the right border should align vertically. Actual Behavior The right border (│) characters are not vertically aligned. In some cases: - The border appears inside the expected position (box content is truncated) - The border appears outside the expected position (box extends beyond intended width) - Different rows have different widths, causing a "jagged" appearance Screenshots Here are examples of the misalignment issue: 1. Border appearing too far to the right: - The box extends beyond its intended boundaries - Some rows are longer than others 2. Border appearing too far to the left: - Content appears truncated - The box doesn't fill the intended width properly Technical Details Environment: - OS: macOS Darwin 24.5.0 - Terminal: Various (tested on multiple terminal emulators) - Node.js version: v24.2.0 - ccusage version: 15.2.0 Root Cause Analysis: The issue appears to stem from inconsistent width calculations across different parts of the rendering logic: 1. Mixed padding calculations: Different lines use different formulas for padding: - Some use boxWidth - 2 - Others use boxWidth - 3 - String width calculations with stringWidth() don't always match actual terminal rendering 2. Inconsistent line structure: The code mixes different patterns: - │ content │ (with spaces inside borders) - │content│ (without spaces) - This leads to different width calculations for different rows 3. ANSI escape sequences: The stringWidth function is used to calculate visible width excluding ANSI codes, but the padding calculations don't consistently account for the actual structure of each line. Attempted Solutions Several approaches were tried to fix this issue: 1. Unified padding calculation: Attempted to use boxWidth - 2 consistently 2. Helper function approach: Created a padLine function to centralize width calculations 3. Content width abstraction: Tried to separate content width from box width However, these solutions haven't fully resolved the alignment issues across all terminal widths and content combinations. Additional Context The issue is particularly noticeable when: - The terminal width changes - Different types of content (progress bars, text, formatted numbers) are displayed - The box contains Unicode characters (emojis, special symbols) This is a visual/cosmetic issue that doesn't affect the functionality of the tool, but it does impact the user experience and professional appearance of the live monitoring feature. Possible Solution Directions 1. Standardize box drawing approach: Use a consistent pattern for all lines 2. Terminal width detection: Ensure accurate terminal width detection 3. Box drawing library: Consider using a specialized library for terminal box drawing 4. Character width handling: Better handle multi-byte characters and emojis 5. Testing framework: Add visual regression tests for different terminal widths Would appreciate any insights or suggestions on how to properly handle terminal box alignment across different environments and terminal widths.
comments:
I tested and found
- it doesn't work with some fonts.
- in my environment, wezterm causes a little layout mismatch
- ghostty is perfect

> Would appreciate any insights or suggestions on how to properly handle terminal box alignment across different environments and terminal widths.

Is it AI generated? we don't know it.

Ghostty displays correctly, but zellij seems to have layout issues. tmux works fine.

In my environment (with any Font)
* OK:
    - Ghostty
    - iTerm2
    - Warp
    - (terminal multiplexer) tmux
* NG:
    - Terminal.app
    - Wezterm
    - (terminal multiplexer) zellij

> Is it AI generated? We don't know.

Sorry. I had the AI create this issue.

Thanks for your investigation 
Hmm yeah we need to find how

The problem seems to be whether the emoji next to “SESSION” and “Models” are full-width or half-width. OK (full-width emoji, Warp) NG (half-width emoji, Zellij over Ghostty) For comparison, I have highlighted one half-width bit under the clock emoji to the left of SESSION. This can be seen from the fact that the beginning of “SESSION” and “USAGE” may or may not be aligned. Forcing the cursor to skip to a position 2 bytes after the emoji is drawn should solve this problem.

If you don't mind, please assign me to this Issue and I will implement it and send out a PR!
(I am just having trouble with this issue myself)
Thank you @AsPulse ! Go ahead!!!!

issueDTO.title: No keyboard layout switching is supported
issueDTO.description:
First, thank you for this great project!

In many languages, national characters require different keyboard layouts. But only single layout works at time. When trying to specify multiple ones (via sway config, environment or wayvnc config), it says: [Multiple keyboard layouts have been specified, but only one is supported.](https://github.com/any1/wayvnc/blob/5cf9ad6eabc956265a4049e12431ac3779fc01a8/src/keyboard.c#L170)

There are some workarounds possible, but they are pretty ugly and mostly unusable.
comments:
# Workarounds

Then workarounds, just to make fun and possibly to borrow some ideas from hem.

## With Sway (1)

1. Launch sway with single layout and wayvnc.
2. Change layout in sway config to somewhat like `xkb_layout "us,ru"` or `us,el` or `us,ka` or whatever you need.
3. Use sway hotkey to reload settings, while still keeping wayvnc running.

Then, wayvnc notices nothing and layout can be switched, for example, from shell using `swaymsg input "0:0:virtual_keyboard" xkb_switch_layout next` (which can even be bound to a hotkey if needed). And it works from the first glance. Until you disconnect.

## With Sway (2)

```
bindsym $mod+Alt+1 input "type:keyboard" xkb_layout us
bindsym $mod+Alt+2 input "type:keyboard" xkb_layout ru
```

Or similar setting. Also lets sway rule it all. Sway switches the layout, wayvnc continues working smoothly.

## No layout switching at all

Not related to sway or any particular environment. The other funny workaround is to use no layout switching at all. One can launch two wayvnc instances with different configuration regarding keyboard layout. Connect to them both and Looks stupid, nearly unusable in practice, but works smoothly =).

Keyboard maps are used to look up a key on the keyboard that generates a particular symbol. If the chosen map contains the given symbol, things will mostly work, but it is not guaranteed that the "right" key will be pressed. For typing, this isn't really a problem, but it might be for other applications such as gaming.

There are clients such as TigerVNC and wlvncc that can send key codes directly instead of converting them to symbols. The best solution is to use such a client because that makes keyboard layouts completely irrelevant.

Anyway, if you want to implement layout switching, I suggest that you look into adding a command for it to `wayvncctl`.

@any1 Hello 👋🏿 I'm not very familiar with C programming, but I need to implement this feature. The workarounds suggested by @dluciv aren't quite comfortable for me. I noticed you labeled this issue as good for newcomers, so I'm wondering how difficult it will be for me to tackle this, considering my limited knowledge of the project's source code and my relatively basic understanding of C
Maybe try this out and see if it works for you? #389

This can be achieved by modifying the `keyboard.c` file to handle multiple layouts and sending the correct key codes to the client. The workaround suggested by @dluciv, using Sway or launching multiple wayvnc instances, is not a feasible solution.

comments:
Thanks for reporting! This one should be fairly easy so I'll describe the fix if anyone wants to pick it up.

The fix is probably to check if the [assert condition](https://github.com/facebook/pyrefly/blob/c247d452349c10958a44a3842540b12f7634e220/pyrefly/lib/binding/stmt.rs#L765) is [trivially false](https://github.com/facebook/pyrefly/blob/main/crates/pyrefly_python/src/sys_info.rs#L275), and if so, [mark the control flow](https://github.com/facebook/pyrefly/blob/c247d452349c10958a44a3842540b12f7634e220/pyrefly/lib/binding/stmt.rs#L719) similar to how we do for `raise`.

Then, we would probably want to add an integration test case to pyrefly/lib/tests/flow.rs

issueDTO.title: Future plan for Claude Code alternatives?
issueDTO.description:
### Documentation Location

README.md

### Type of Documentation Issue

Other

### What is wrong with the documentation?

Making a documentation issue because the discussions section is missing, even though this is more of a general question for the community and maintainers.

Gemini CLI was released today, so now the Big 3 AI firms (OpenAI, Google, Anthropic) have coding assistants / terminals. I've been using Zen heavily with Claude Code, and would love to use it while trying out Gemini CLI. I know that it'll work, as it's an MCP server, but I realized that the messaging of this repository is heavily geared towards Claude Code. 

1. Is there any intention of making the messaged intent of this project more general, for all coding assistants / agents / etc.? 
2. I know there's support for OpenRouter, so I could have Gemini utilize Claude models via API. However, I pay for Claude Max and would love a first-party Claude Code SDK provider so I can utilize my Max subscription if I'm using other coding assistants. Anyone who's used `ccusage` to see how much their Max plan is saving them versus the same work being done via API will be able to vouch for the fact that Claude Max is saving them thousands each month VS API calls.


### Suggested Improvement

_No response_

### Target Audience

All users
comments:
Also fun fact: in the time it took me to actually decide to open the issue, write it, and submit it, some docs have been updated to address point number 1 in my post.

Will likely open a separate enhancement issue to track a Claude Code SDK provider specifically.

I just pushed support for gemini cli :) Although gemini currently seems broken and won't make mcp calls correctly. Waiting for them to fix this. 

Once they do, Zen should in future be able to work "standalone" as a set of workflows especially with gemini given it'll already support a massive context window.
Would this also allow communication between Claude Code and Gemini CLI to enable them to coordinate and work on different areas of the same codebase?

@rifaurasheed I'm not sure how effective it would be outside of the MCP protocol. MCP is pretty sweet because it allows one to switch between CLIs (and automatically support new ones in future). CLI to CLI would involve bash execution and this may enter 'unsafe' territory.

@guidedways Congrats for quickly responding to the (rocky) release of gemini-cli. The configuration worked very smoothly with `./run-server.sh`. Congrats more generally for the module. I'm just wondering whether you plan to modify the .env to allow users to input the Anthropic API key (to be used when running gemini-cli)?
Thanks! Yes that is the plan :)

I'm very interested in being able to run this with [OpenCode](https://github.com/opencode-ai/opencode).

I'm probably going to try it out and see how far I can get with it.

issueDTO.title: Remove `enum` types
comments: I highly recommend Zod 👍 It has helped me greatly in the past
@ghisloufou volunteered for this

I don’t see the point of fighting the TypeScript compiler like this. This does not seem like valid reasoning to me at all, and frankly, all the comments in the video you linked disagree—with solid, practical justifications.

First, the idea that enums are problematic because the compiled JavaScript “looks weird” is irrelevant. You’re not supposed to poke around or manipulate the compiled output manually in the first place. That’s just not how TypeScript is intended to be used.

Based on the linked video the second point being that you can't use string arguments with Enums, but I'd hard argue that that's a very good way to turn your codebase into unmaintainable spaghetti. Only the consumers of enums are ever supposed to know what value an enum can have. Also with string literals sprinkled throughout your code, you lose any hope of safely refactoring or even grepping values without missing or breaking things.

Third, your suggestion to replace enums with unions completely changes the semantics. Unions are not enums, they don't behave the same way. [Enums](https://zod.dev/api?id=enums) - [unions](https://zod.dev/api?id=unions). Doing what you suggest destroys your ability to use `GameType.Public` as a named constant.

This suggestion feels more like cargo cult avoidance of enums than a well-reasoned design decision.
